element: Action: This is a Southern story, full of lies and fabrications, but truer for their inclusion.
original_content: This is a Southern story, full of lies and fabrications, but truer for their inclusion.
element_text: This is a Southern story, full of lies and fabrications, but truer for their inclusion.

element: Action: We're underwater, watching a fat catfish swim along.
original_content: We're underwater, watching a fat catfish swim along.
element_text: We're underwater, watching a fat catfish swim along.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
There are some fish that cannot be caught.  It's not that they're faster or stronger than other fish.  They're just touched by something extra.  Call it luck.  Call it grace.  One such fish was The Beast.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
There are some fish that cannot be caught.  It's not that they're faster or stronger than other fish.  They're just touched by something extra.  Call it luck.  Call it grace.  One such fish was The Beast.

element: Action: The Beast's journey takes it past a dangling fish hook, baited with worms.  Past a tempting lure, sparkling in the sun.  Past a swiping bear claw.  The Beast isn't worried.
original_content: The Beast's journey takes it past a dangling fish hook, baited with worms.  Past a tempting lure, sparkling in the sun.  Past a swiping bear claw.  The Beast isn't worried.
element_text: The Beast's journey takes it past a dangling fish hook, baited with worms.  Past a tempting lure, sparkling in the sun.  Past a swiping bear claw.  The Beast isn't worried.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)(CONT'D)
By the time I was born, he was already a legend.  He'd taken more hundred-dollar lures than any fish in Alabama. Some said that fish was the ghost of Henry Walls, a thief who'd drowned in that river 60 years before.   Others claimed he was a lesser dinosaur, left over from the Cretaceous period.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)(CONT'D)
By the time I was born, he was already a legend.  He'd taken more hundred-dollar lures than any fish in Alabama. Some said that fish was the ghost of Henry Walls, a thief who'd drowned in that river 60 years before.   Others claimed he was a lesser dinosaur, left over from the Cretaceous period.

element: Action: WILL BLOOM, AGE 3, listens wide-eyed as his father EDWARD BLOOM, 40's and handsome, tells the story.  In every gesture, Edward is bigger than life, describing each detail with absolute conviction.
original_content: WILL BLOOM, AGE 3, listens wide-eyed as his father EDWARD BLOOM, 40's and handsome, tells the story.  In every gesture, Edward is bigger than life, describing each detail with absolute conviction.
element_text: WILL BLOOM, AGE 3, listens wide-eyed as his father EDWARD BLOOM, 40's and handsome, tells the story.  In every gesture, Edward is bigger than life, describing each detail with absolute conviction.

element: Dialogue: I didn't put any stock into such speculation or superstition.  All I knew was I'd been trying to catch that fish since I was a boy no bigger than you.
original_content: I didn't put any stock into such speculation or superstition.  All I knew was I'd been trying to catch that fish since I was a boy no bigger than you.
element_text: I didn't put any stock into such speculation or superstition.  All I knew was I'd been trying to catch that fish since I was a boy no bigger than you.

element: Dialogue: And on the day you were born, that was the day I finally caught him.
original_content: And on the day you were born, that was the day I finally caught him.
element_text: And on the day you were born, that was the day I finally caught him.

element: Action: A few years later, and Will sits with the other INDIAN GUIDES as Edward continues telling the story to the tribe.
original_content: A few years later, and Will sits with the other INDIAN GUIDES as Edward continues telling the story to the tribe.
element_text: A few years later, and Will sits with the other INDIAN GUIDES as Edward continues telling the story to the tribe.

element: Dialogue: Now, I'd tried everything on it:  worms, lures, peanut butter, peanut butter-and-cheese.  But on that day I had a revelation:  if that fish was the ghost of a thief, the usual bait wasn't going to work.  I would have to use something he truly desired.
original_content: Now, I'd tried everything on it:  worms, lures, peanut butter, peanut butter-and-cheese.  But on that day I had a revelation:  if that fish was the ghost of a thief, the usual bait wasn't going to work.  I would have to use something he truly desired.
element_text: Now, I'd tried everything on it:  worms, lures, peanut butter, peanut butter-and-cheese.  But on that day I had a revelation:  if that fish was the ghost of a thief, the usual bait wasn't going to work.  I would have to use something he truly desired.

element: Action: Edward points to his wedding band, glinting in the firelight.
original_content: Edward points to his wedding band, glinting in the firelight.
element_text: Edward points to his wedding band, glinting in the firelight.

element: Action: Edward slips his ring off.
Action: While the other boys are rapt with attention, Will looks bored.  He's heard this story before.
original_content: While the other boys are rapt with attention, Will looks bored.  He's heard this story before.
element_text: While the other boys are rapt with attention, Will looks bored.  He's heard this story before.

element: Dialogue: I tied my ring to the strongest line they made -- strong enough to hold up a bridge, they said, if just for a few minutes -- and I cast upriver.
original_content: I tied my ring to the strongest line they made -- strong enough to hold up a bridge, they said, if just for a few minutes -- and I cast upriver.

The Beast jumped up and grabbed it before the ring even hit the water.  And just as fast, he snapped clean through that line.

element: Dialogue: I followed that fish up-river and down-river for three days and three nights, until I finally had him boxed in.

element: Dialogue: This fish, the Beast.  The whole time we were calling it a him, when in fact it was a her.  It was fat with eggs, and was going to lay them any day.

element: Dialogue: Now, I was in a situation.  I could gut that fish and get my ring back, but doing so I would be killing the smartest catfish in the Ashton River, soon to be mother of a hundred others.
original_content: Now, I was in a situation.  I could gut that fish and get my ring back, but doing so I would be killing the smartest catfish in the Ashton River, soon to be mother of a hundred others.

element: Action: Will can't take any more.  Josephine tries to hold him back, but he gets up and leaves.  Edward doesn't even notice.
original_content: Will can't take any more.  Josephine tries to hold him back, but he gets up and leaves.  Edward doesn't even notice.

Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Did I want to deprive my soon-to-be-born son the chance to catch a fish like this of his own?  This lady fish and I, well, we had the same destiny.

EDWARD (CONT'D)
Did I want to deprive my soon-to-be-born son the chance to catch a fish like this of his own?  This lady fish and I, well, we had the same destiny.

My father's birth would set the pace for his unlikely life.  No longer than most men's, but larger.  And as strange as his stories got, the endings were always the most surprising of all.

This all happened in the swamp outside of Ashton.  Kids weren't supposed to go out in the swamp, on account of the snakes and spiders and quicksand that would swallow you up before you could even scream.  But there were five of us out there that night:  Me, Ruthie, Wilbur Freely, and the Price Brothers, Don and Zacky.

Action: ADULT EDWARD (V.O.)
Now, it's common knowledge that most towns of a certain size have a witch, if only to eat misbehaving children and the occasional puppy who wanders into her yard.  Witches use those bones to cast spells and curses that make the land infertile.

element: Dialogue: I'm so glad you're here.
Action: That hug finished, Sandra pushes past her son to her daughter-in-law.  Seeing the size of her belly --
original_content: That hug finished, Sandra pushes past her son to her daughter-in-law.  Seeing the size of her belly --
element_text: That hug finished, Sandra pushes past her son to her daughter-in-law.  Seeing the size of her belly --

element: Dialogue: You shouldn't have flown.  But...
Dialogue: It's good to see you.  You look beautiful.
original_content: It's good to see you.  You look beautiful.
element_text: It's good to see you.  You look beautiful.

element: Action: It's not flattery.  It's the truth.
original_content: It's not flattery.  It's the truth.
element_text: It's not flattery.  It's the truth.

element: Dialogue: Thank you.  I'll bet you need to --
original_content: Thank you.  I'll bet you need to --
element_text: Thank you.  I'll bet you need to --

element: Dialogue: Down the hall on the right.  The door sticks.  You have to really pull it.
original_content: Down the hall on the right.  The door sticks.  You have to really pull it.
element_text: Down the hall on the right.  The door sticks.  You have to really pull it.

element: Action: Josephine squeezes past, a smile to her husband -- be nice.  Will heads back to the rental car to retrieve luggage.  Sandra follows him.
original_content: Josephine squeezes past, a smile to her husband -- be nice.  Will heads back to the rental car to retrieve luggage.  Sandra follows him.
element_text: Josephine squeezes past, a smile to her husband -- be nice.  Will heads back to the rental car to retrieve luggage.  Sandra follows him.

element: Action: Coming down the driveway, we get to see the house for the first time:  an older suburban home, three bedrooms, big for the neighborhood, and nicely grown into the lot.  KIDS are playing on the street.
original_content: Coming down the driveway, we get to see the house for the first time:  an older suburban home, three bedrooms, big for the neighborhood, and nicely grown into the lot.  KIDS are playing on the street.
element_text: Coming down the driveway, we get to see the house for the first time:  an older suburban home, three bedrooms, big for the neighborhood, and nicely grown into the lot.  KIDS are playing on the street.

element: Dialogue: Is that Dr. Bennett's car?
Dialogue: He's up with your father.
Action: Heading back to the house...
Dialogue: He's impossible.  He won't eat.   And because he won't eat, he gets weaker.  And because he's weaker, he doesn't want to eat.
original_content: He's impossible.  He won't eat.   And because he won't eat, he gets weaker.  And because he's weaker, he doesn't want to eat.
element_text: He's impossible.  He won't eat.   And because he won't eat, he gets weaker.  And because he's weaker, he doesn't want to eat.

element: Dialogue: How much time does he have left?
original_content: How much time does he have left?
element_text: How much time does he have left?

element: Dialogue: You don't talk about those things.  Not yet.
original_content: You don't talk about those things.  Not yet.
element_text: You don't talk about those things.  Not yet.

element: Action: Sandra is pouring iced tea for Will and Josephine.
original_content: Sandra is pouring iced tea for Will and Josephine.
element_text: Sandra is pouring iced tea for Will and Josephine.

element: Action: DR. JULIUS BENNETT (85) enters from the foyer, still winded from coming down the stairs.  He was the town's first Black physician.  He's still the town's best physician.
original_content: DR. JULIUS BENNETT (85) enters from the foyer, still winded from coming down the stairs.  He was the town's first Black physician.  He's still the town's best physician.
element_text: DR. JULIUS BENNETT (85) enters from the foyer, still winded from coming down the stairs.  He was the town's first Black physician.  He's still the town's best physician.

element: Dialogue: Dr. Bennett.  It's good to see you.
original_content: Dr. Bennett.  It's good to see you.
element_text: Dr. Bennett.  It's good to see you.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT (CONT'D)
You're seven months.
Action: He leans close to her, whispering in her ear...
original_content: He leans close to her, whispering in her ear...
element_text: He leans close to her, whispering in her ear...

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
It's a boy.
Action: She smiles, surprised but not doubting.  Will looks over -- what did he say?  Josephine shakes her head.
original_content: She smiles, surprised but not doubting.  Will looks over -- what did he say?  Josephine shakes her head.
element_text: She smiles, surprised but not doubting.  Will looks over -- what did he say?  Josephine shakes her head.

element: Action: Back to the main subject...
Dialogue: You don't think he looks any worse.
original_content: You don't think he looks any worse.
element_text: You don't think he looks any worse.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
No.  I would say he's the same.
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
No.  I would say he's the same.

element: Action: And in the silence that follows, a lot is said.  It wasn't the upbeat reply Sandra was hoping for.
original_content: And in the silence that follows, a lot is said.  It wasn't the upbeat reply Sandra was hoping for.
element_text: And in the silence that follows, a lot is said.  It wasn't the upbeat reply Sandra was hoping for.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
Absolutely.  Be good for you to talk to him.
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
Absolutely.  Be good for you to talk to him.

element: Action: A moment of awkwardness -- everyone here knows they haven't spoken in years.
original_content: A moment of awkwardness -- everyone here knows they haven't spoken in years.
element_text: A moment of awkwardness -- everyone here knows they haven't spoken in years.

element: Action: Sandra hands Will a squat can of Ensure from the case on the counter.
original_content: Sandra hands Will a squat can of Ensure from the case on the counter.
element_text: Sandra hands Will a squat can of Ensure from the case on the counter.

element: Dialogue: Get him to drink one of these.  He won't, but tell him he has to.
original_content: Get him to drink one of these.  He won't, but tell him he has to.
element_text: Get him to drink one of these.  He won't, but tell him he has to.

element: Action: Coming out from the kitchen, Will slowly climbs the stairs.  They CREAK with every step.
original_content: Coming out from the kitchen, Will slowly climbs the stairs.  They CREAK with every step.
element_text: Coming out from the kitchen, Will slowly climbs the stairs.  They CREAK with every step.

element: Action: The wall is filled with family photos, happier times.  Most of the pictures are of Will, starting when he was an infant and ending at his wedding.  As he climbs the stairs, we can see him growing up with every step.
original_content: The wall is filled with family photos, happier times.  Most of the pictures are of Will, starting when he was an infant and ending at his wedding.  As he climbs the stairs, we can see him growing up with every step.

element: Action: A crack of sunlight spills around the half-open door at the end of the hallway.  Will walks towards it, running a hand along the wallpaper.
original_content: A crack of sunlight spills around the half-open door at the end of the hallway.  Will walks towards it, running a hand along the wallpaper.
element_text: A crack of sunlight spills around the half-open door at the end of the hallway.  Will walks towards it, running a hand along the wallpaper.

element: Action: Almost at the door, he stops for a beat.  Gets his breath.  Then goes inside.
original_content: Almost at the door, he stops for a beat.  Gets his breath.  Then goes inside.
element_text: Almost at the door, he stops for a beat.  Gets his breath.  Then goes inside.

element: Action: Edward Bloom, 61, lies asleep on the bed.  Although he's not the vibrant man we've seen before, it's not as bad we feared.  The illness has been quick, and left him largely intact.
original_content: Edward Bloom, 61, lies asleep on the bed.  Although he's not the vibrant man we've seen before, it's not as bad we feared.  The illness has been quick, and left him largely intact.
element_text: Edward Bloom, 61, lies asleep on the bed.  Although he's not the vibrant man we've seen before, it's not as bad we feared.  The illness has been quick, and left him largely intact.

element: Action: There are no I.V.'s, no monitors, nothing.
original_content: There are no I.V.'s, no monitors, nothing.
element_text: There are no I.V.'s, no monitors, nothing.

element: Action: Coming up to the bed --
Action: Edward cracks open an eye, a beat before he focuses.  He tries to say something, but no words come out.
original_content: Edward cracks open an eye, a beat before he focuses.  He tries to say something, but no words come out.
element_text: Edward cracks open an eye, a beat before he focuses.  He tries to say something, but no words come out.

element: Action: He looks over at a pitcher on the nightstand.  Will pours him a glass of water, helping him hold it to his parched lips.
original_content: He looks over at a pitcher on the nightstand.  Will pours him a glass of water, helping him hold it to his parched lips.
element_text: He looks over at a pitcher on the nightstand.  Will pours him a glass of water, helping him hold it to his parched lips.

element: Action: Finished, Edward sets down the glass by himself.  A very long, tense beat.  Will almost speaks again to fill the silence.
original_content: Finished, Edward sets down the glass by himself.  A very long, tense beat.  Will almost speaks again to fill the silence.
element_text: Finished, Edward sets down the glass by himself.  A very long, tense beat.  Will almost speaks again to fill the silence.

element: Dialogue: -- are in for a surprise.
Dialogue: Having a kid changes everything.  I mean, there's the diapers and the burping and the midnight feedings...
original_content: Having a kid changes everything.  I mean, there's the diapers and the burping and the midnight feedings...
element_text: Having a kid changes everything.  I mean, there's the diapers and the burping and the midnight feedings...

element: Dialogue: Did you do any of that?
original_content: Did you do any of that?
element_text: Did you do any of that?

element: Dialogue: No, but I hear it's terrible.  Then you spend years trying to corrupt and mislead this child, fill its head with nonsense and still it turns out perfectly fine.
original_content: No, but I hear it's terrible.  Then you spend years trying to corrupt and mislead this child, fill its head with nonsense and still it turns out perfectly fine.
element_text: No, but I hear it's terrible.  Then you spend years trying to corrupt and mislead this child, fill its head with nonsense and still it turns out perfectly fine.

element: Dialogue: You think I'm up for it?
original_content: You think I'm up for it?
element_text: You think I'm up for it?

element: Dialogue: You learned from the best.
Action: Will doesn't rise to the challenge.  A beat, then he remembers the can of Ensure.  Holds it up.  Edward recoils.
original_content: Will doesn't rise to the challenge.  A beat, then he remembers the can of Ensure.  Holds it up.  Edward recoils.
element_text: Will doesn't rise to the challenge.  A beat, then he remembers the can of Ensure.  Holds it up.  Edward recoils.

element: Dialogue: Just drink half the can.  I'll tell her you drank the whole thing.  Everyone wins.
original_content: Just drink half the can.  I'll tell her you drank the whole thing.  Everyone wins.
element_text: Just drink half the can.  I'll tell her you drank the whole thing.  Everyone wins.

element: Action: A beat, then Edward rolls his eyes.  Fine.  Will cracks open the can, finding a straw on the nightstand.
original_content: A beat, then Edward rolls his eyes.  Fine.  Will cracks open the can, finding a straw on the nightstand.
element_text: A beat, then Edward rolls his eyes.  Fine.  Will cracks open the can, finding a straw on the nightstand.

element: Dialogue: People needn't worry so much.  It's not my time yet.  This isn't how I go.
original_content: People needn't worry so much.  It's not my time yet.  This isn't how I go.
element_text: People needn't worry so much.  It's not my time yet.  This isn't how I go.

element: Dialogue: Truly.  I saw it in The Eye.
original_content: Truly.  I saw it in The Eye.
element_text: Truly.  I saw it in The Eye.

element: Dialogue: The Old Lady by the swamp.
original_content: The Old Lady by the swamp.
element_text: The Old Lady by the swamp.

element: Dialogue: No, she was old and probably senile.  Maybe schizophrenic.
original_content: No, she was old and probably senile.  Maybe schizophrenic.
element_text: No, she was old and probably senile.  Maybe schizophrenic.

element: Dialogue: I saw my death in that eye.  And this is not how it happens.
original_content: I saw my death in that eye.  And this is not how it happens.
element_text: I saw my death in that eye.  And this is not how it happens.

element: Dialogue: So how does it happen?
Dialogue: Surprise ending.  Wouldn't want to ruin it for you.
original_content: Surprise ending.  Wouldn't want to ruin it for you.
element_text: Surprise ending.  Wouldn't want to ruin it for you.

element: Action: Edward slurps down as much of the Ensure as he can stand, then pushes the can away.  He swallows with difficulty.
original_content: Edward slurps down as much of the Ensure as he can stand, then pushes the can away.  He swallows with difficulty.
element_text: Edward slurps down as much of the Ensure as he can stand, then pushes the can away.  He swallows with difficulty.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
There was this panhandler who used to stop me every morning when I came out of this coffee shop near the office.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
There was this panhandler who used to stop me every morning when I came out of this coffee shop near the office.

element: Dialogue: And every day I gave him a quarter.  Every day.  Then I got sick and was out for a couple of weeks.  And when I went back there, you know what he said?
original_content: And every day I gave him a quarter.  Every day.  Then I got sick and was out for a couple of weeks.  And when I went back there, you know what he said?
element_text: And every day I gave him a quarter.  Every day.  Then I got sick and was out for a couple of weeks.  And when I went back there, you know what he said?

element: Dialogue: When did you ever work in an office?
original_content: When did you ever work in an office?
element_text: When did you ever work in an office?

element: Dialogue: There's a lot you don't know about me.
original_content: There's a lot you don't know about me.
element_text: There's a lot you don't know about me.

element: Action: Edward gives a wry smile.  He walked into that.
original_content: Edward gives a wry smile.  He walked into that.
element_text: Edward gives a wry smile.  He walked into that.

element: Dialogue: Your mother was worried we wouldn't talk again.  And look at us.  We're talking fine.  We're storytellers, both of us.  I speak mine out, you write yours down.  Same thing.
original_content: Your mother was worried we wouldn't talk again.  And look at us.  We're talking fine.  We're storytellers, both of us.  I speak mine out, you write yours down.  Same thing.
element_text: Your mother was worried we wouldn't talk again.  And look at us.  We're talking fine.  We're storytellers, both of us.  I speak mine out, you write yours down.  Same thing.

element: Action: Will won't commit to Edward's assessment.
original_content: Will won't commit to Edward's assessment.
element_text: Will won't commit to Edward's assessment.

element: Dialogue: Dad, I'm hoping we can talk about some things while I'm here.
original_content: Dad, I'm hoping we can talk about some things while I'm here.
element_text: Dad, I'm hoping we can talk about some things while I'm here.

element: Dialogue: I'd just like to know the true versions of things.  Events.  Stories.  You.
original_content: I'd just like to know the true versions of things.  Events.  Stories.  You.
element_text: I'd just like to know the true versions of things.  Events.  Stories.  You.

element: Action: Edward LAUGHS a little, which becomes a COUGH.  The HACKING escalates until another drink of water gets it under control.  It's not clear whether any of this was an act to keep from talking.
original_content: Edward LAUGHS a little, which becomes a COUGH.  The HACKING escalates until another drink of water gets it under control.  It's not clear whether any of this was an act to keep from talking.
element_text: Edward LAUGHS a little, which becomes a COUGH.  The HACKING escalates until another drink of water gets it under control.  It's not clear whether any of this was an act to keep from talking.

element: Dialogue: Your mother hasn't been keeping up the pool.  If you wanted to you could...
original_content: Your mother hasn't been keeping up the pool.  If you wanted to you could...
element_text: Your mother hasn't been keeping up the pool.  If you wanted to you could...

element: Dialogue: You know where the chemicals are?
original_content: You know where the chemicals are?
element_text: You know where the chemicals are?

element: Dialogue: I used to do it when you were gone, remember?  I used to do it a lot.
original_content: I used to do it when you were gone, remember?  I used to do it a lot.
element_text: I used to do it when you were gone, remember?  I used to do it a lot.

element: Action: He didn't mean for that to sound so pointed.  Taking the half-empty Ensure, Will gets up to go.  He's at the door when...
original_content: He didn't mean for that to sound so pointed.  Taking the half-empty Ensure, Will gets up to go.  He's at the door when...
element_text: He didn't mean for that to sound so pointed.  Taking the half-empty Ensure, Will gets up to go.  He's at the door when...

element: Dialogue: I was never much for being at home, Will.  It's too confining.  And this, here.  Being stuck in bed.  Dying is the worst thing that ever happened to me.
original_content: I was never much for being at home, Will.  It's too confining.  And this, here.  Being stuck in bed.  Dying is the worst thing that ever happened to me.
element_text: I was never much for being at home, Will.  It's too confining.  And this, here.  Being stuck in bed.  Dying is the worst thing that ever happened to me.

element: Action: He smiles at his joke.
Dialogue: I thought you weren't dying.
Dialogue: I said this isn't how I go.  The last part is much more unusual.  Trust me on that.
original_content: I said this isn't how I go.  The last part is much more unusual.  Trust me on that.
element_text: I said this isn't how I go.  The last part is much more unusual.  Trust me on that.

element: Action: Shutting the door behind himself, Will drinks the rest of the Ensure himself.  Edward was right.  It tastes horrible.
original_content: Shutting the door behind himself, Will drinks the rest of the Ensure himself.  Edward was right.  It tastes horrible.
element_text: Shutting the door behind himself, Will drinks the rest of the Ensure himself.  Edward was right.  It tastes horrible.

element: Action: Heading for the stairs, Will walks past an open door.  As he leaves frame, we STAY BEHIND to look inside...
original_content: Heading for the stairs, Will walks past an open door.  As he leaves frame, we STAY BEHIND to look inside...
element_text: Heading for the stairs, Will walks past an open door.  As he leaves frame, we STAY BEHIND to look inside...

element: Action: ...where an eight-year old Will is propped up in bed, his face covered with chicken pox and pink calamine lotion.  He's showing Edward how many bumps there are on his arm.
original_content: ...where an eight-year old Will is propped up in bed, his face covered with chicken pox and pink calamine lotion.  He's showing Edward how many bumps there are on his arm.
element_text: ...where an eight-year old Will is propped up in bed, his face covered with chicken pox and pink calamine lotion.  He's showing Edward how many bumps there are on his arm.

element: Dialogue: Dr. Bennett says I'm going to have to be home for a week.
original_content: Dr. Bennett says I'm going to have to be home for a week.
element_text: Dr. Bennett says I'm going to have to be home for a week.

element: Dialogue: That's nothing.  I once had to stay in bed for three years.
original_content: That's nothing.  I once had to stay in bed for three years.
element_text: That's nothing.  I once had to stay in bed for three years.

element: Dialogue: Did you have chicken pox?
Action: Wearing a white shirt and tie, YOUNG EDWARD -- still about 10 -- sings "Down to the River My Lord" along with the CONGREGATION.  His voice is high and thin, but he gives it his all.
original_content: Wearing a white shirt and tie, YOUNG EDWARD -- still about 10 -- sings "Down to the River My Lord" along with the CONGREGATION.  His voice is high and thin, but he gives it his all.
element_text: Wearing a white shirt and tie, YOUNG EDWARD -- still about 10 -- sings "Down to the River My Lord" along with the CONGREGATION.  His voice is high and thin, but he gives it his all.

element: Action: Suddenly, his voice CRACKS and DROPS a half-octave.  And then another.  His friends Wilbur Freeley and Ruthie look over, wondering what's wrong.  Embarrassed, Edward just keeps SINGING, trying to follow along with the baritone part.
original_content: Suddenly, his voice CRACKS and DROPS a half-octave.  And then another.  His friends Wilbur Freeley and Ruthie look over, wondering what's wrong.  Embarrassed, Edward just keeps SINGING, trying to follow along with the baritone part.
element_text: Suddenly, his voice CRACKS and DROPS a half-octave.  And then another.  His friends Wilbur Freeley and Ruthie look over, wondering what's wrong.  Embarrassed, Edward just keeps SINGING, trying to follow along with the baritone part.

element: Action: He pulls at his collar.  Then pulls again, his face getting red.  Starting to panic, he loosens his tie.  He's starting to undo the collar button when it POPS off by itself.  Two more buttons fly off.  One hits a CHUBBY WOMAN in the neck.
original_content: He pulls at his collar.  Then pulls again, his face getting red.  Starting to panic, he loosens his tie.  He's starting to undo the collar button when it POPS off by itself.  Two more buttons fly off.  One hits a CHUBBY WOMAN in the neck.
element_text: He pulls at his collar.  Then pulls again, his face getting red.  Starting to panic, he loosens his tie.  He's starting to undo the collar button when it POPS off by itself.  Two more buttons fly off.  One hits a CHUBBY WOMAN in the neck.

element: Action: As we watch, Edward's pant cuffs rise inch by inch -- that's how fast he's growing.
original_content: As we watch, Edward's pant cuffs rise inch by inch -- that's how fast he's growing.
element_text: As we watch, Edward's pant cuffs rise inch by inch -- that's how fast he's growing.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
Truth is, no one quite knew what was wrong.  Most times, a person grows up gradually.  I found myself in a hurry.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
Truth is, no one quite knew what was wrong.  Most times, a person grows up gradually.  I found myself in a hurry.

element: Scene Heading: YOUNG EDWARD'S BEDROOM - DAY
Action: Young Edward lies in bed, his limbs connected to various pulleys and levers to support his weight.  He has a dozen encyclopedias around him, and another dozen on the floor.
original_content: Young Edward lies in bed, his limbs connected to various pulleys and levers to support his weight.  He has a dozen encyclopedias around him, and another dozen on the floor.
element_text: Young Edward lies in bed, his limbs connected to various pulleys and levers to support his weight.  He has a dozen encyclopedias around him, and another dozen on the floor.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
My muscles couldn't keep up with my bones, and my bones couldn't keep up with my body's ambition.  So I spent the better part of three years confined to my bed, with the World Book Encyclopedia being my only means of exploration.  I had made it all the way to the "G's," hoping to find an answer to my gigantificationism, when I uncovered an article about the common goldfish.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
My muscles couldn't keep up with my bones, and my bones couldn't keep up with my body's ambition.  So I spent the better part of three years confined to my bed, with the World Book Encyclopedia being my only means of exploration.  I had made it all the way to the "G's," hoping to find an answer to my gigantificationism, when I uncovered an article about the common goldfish.

element: Action: INSERT:  The encyclopedia article, complete with drawings.
original_content: INSERT:  The encyclopedia article, complete with drawings.
element_text: INSERT:  The encyclopedia article, complete with drawings.

element: Dialogue: "Kept in a small bowl, the goldfish will remain small.  With more space, the fish can grow double, triple, or quadruple its size."
original_content: "Kept in a small bowl, the goldfish will remain small.  With more space, the fish can grow double, triple, or quadruple its size."
element_text: "Kept in a small bowl, the goldfish will remain small.  With more space, the fish can grow double, triple, or quadruple its size."

element: Action: Young Edward thinks this through.

Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
It occurred to me then, that perhaps the reason for my growth was that I was intended for larger things.  After all, a giant man can't have an ordinary-sized life.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
It occurred to me then, that perhaps the reason for my growth was that I was intended for larger things.  After all, a giant man can't have an ordinary-sized life.

element: Action: The CRACK of a bat announces the game-winning home run.  The crowd CHEERS the swing, and especially the batter as he rounds the bases.
original_content: The CRACK of a bat announces the game-winning home run.  The crowd CHEERS the swing, and especially the batter as he rounds the bases.
element_text: The CRACK of a bat announces the game-winning home run.  The crowd CHEERS the swing, and especially the batter as he rounds the bases.

element: Action: Although we've seen him briefly before, this is our first real exposure to GROWN-UP EDWARD, who we'll follow from roughly the ages of 18 to 30.
original_content: Although we've seen him briefly before, this is our first real exposure to GROWN-UP EDWARD, who we'll follow from roughly the ages of 18 to 30.
element_text: Although we've seen him briefly before, this is our first real exposure to GROWN-UP EDWARD, who we'll follow from roughly the ages of 18 to 30.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.0.)
As soon as my bones had settled in their adult configuration, I set upon my plan to make a bigger place for myself in Ashton.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.0.)
As soon as my bones had settled in their adult configuration, I set upon my plan to make a bigger place for myself in Ashton.

original_content: SINGLE SHOT:  A lawnmower ROARS along the grass.  We LOOK UP to see who's pushing it, but it's not Edward.  It's one of his teenage EMPLOYEES.

element: Action: Edward carries a dog out of a burning house.

element: Action: Edward wins a blue ribbon for his invention, a machine labelled "Perpetual Motion."  He and the JUDGE pose for a photograph.  A FLASH.

element_text: Edward wins a blue ribbon for his invention, a machine labelled "Perpetual Motion."  He and the JUDGE pose for a photograph.  A FLASH.

element: Action: Pissed, Don Price throws his crappy lima bean plants in the trash.

element: Scene Heading: HIGH SCHOOL STAGE - DAY
Action: A dashingly handsome Edward leads the CAST out for a curtain call.  He's the star of the show.  Off to the side, we see Don Price is the ass-end of a horse costume.
original_content: A dashingly handsome Edward leads the CAST out for a curtain call.  He's the star of the show.  Off to the side, we see Don Price is the ass-end of a horse costume.
element_text: A dashingly handsome Edward leads the CAST out for a curtain call.  He's the star of the show.  Off to the side, we see Don Price is the ass-end of a horse costume.

element: Action: Edward soaks in his applause, smiling and gracious.
original_content: Edward soaks in his applause, smiling and gracious.
element_text: Edward soaks in his applause, smiling and gracious.

element: Action: Edward accepts his diploma.  The PRINCIPAL hugs him tight.
original_content: Edward accepts his diploma.  The PRINCIPAL hugs him tight.
element_text: Edward accepts his diploma.  The PRINCIPAL hugs him tight.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
I was the biggest thing Ashton had ever seen.  Until one day, a stranger arrived.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
I was the biggest thing Ashton had ever seen.  Until one day, a stranger arrived.

element: Action: As two FARMERS shake their heads, we REVERSE to a show a massive hole punched through the side of a barn.  It's roughly the shape of man, but no human could be that large.
original_content: As two FARMERS shake their heads, we REVERSE to a show a massive hole punched through the side of a barn.  It's roughly the shape of man, but no human could be that large.
element_text: As two FARMERS shake their heads, we REVERSE to a show a massive hole punched through the side of a barn.  It's roughly the shape of man, but no human could be that large.

element: Action: Two fat ewes look up, a shadow falling across them.  They BLEAT in panic as
original_content: Two fat ewes look up, a shadow falling across them.  They BLEAT in panic as
element_text: Two fat ewes look up, a shadow falling across them.  They BLEAT in panic as

element: Action: reach in and scoop them up.  Their protests continue as they're carried away, one under each arm.  We still haven't seen the full stranger.
original_content: reach in and scoop them up.  Their protests continue as they're carried away, one under each arm.  We still haven't seen the full stranger.
element_text: reach in and scoop them up.  Their protests continue as they're carried away, one under each arm.  We still haven't seen the full stranger.

element: Action: A MOB of about 50 have gathered, many of them with shotguns.  Amid the crowd we see Don Price.
original_content: A MOB of about 50 have gathered, many of them with shotguns.  Amid the crowd we see Don Price.
element_text: A MOB of about 50 have gathered, many of them with shotguns.  Amid the crowd we see Don Price.

element: Dialogue: He ate an entire cornfield!

Action: HOT-BLOODED SHOTGUN TOTER
If you ain't gonna stop him Mayor, we will!
element_text:
HOT-BLOODED SHOTGUN TOTER
If you ain't gonna stop him Mayor, we will!

element: Dialogue: I won't have mob violence in this town.  Now, has someone tried talking to him?
original_content: I won't have mob violence in this town.  Now, has someone tried talking to him?
element_text: I won't have mob violence in this town.  Now, has someone tried talking to him?

element: Action: Agreement from the crowd.  And then...
original_content: Agreement from the crowd.  And then...
element_text: Agreement from the crowd.  And then...

element:
Action: A VOICE (O.S.)
I'll do it.
Action: Everyone turns to see who said that.  The crowd parts to reveal none other than Edward Bloom.  Don Price glowers.
original_content: Everyone turns to see who said that.  The crowd parts to reveal none other than Edward Bloom.  Don Price glowers.
element_text: Everyone turns to see who said that.  The crowd parts to reveal none other than Edward Bloom.  Don Price glowers.

element: Dialogue: I'll talk to him.  See if I can get him to move on.
original_content: I'll talk to him.  See if I can get him to move on.
element_text: I'll talk to him.  See if I can get him to move on.

element: Dialogue: Son, that creature could crush you without trying.
original_content: Son, that creature could crush you without trying.
element_text: Son, that creature could crush you without trying.

element: Dialogue: Trust me, he'll have to try.
original_content: Trust me, he'll have to try.
element_text: Trust me, he'll have to try.

element: Scene Heading: HILL OUTSIDE ASHTON - DAY
Action: Edward climbs up the last bit of the steep hillside, reaching the mouth of a cave.  Outside, buzzards squabble over the remains of the giant's feast:  broken barrels, bones picked clean.
original_content: Edward climbs up the last bit of the steep hillside, reaching the mouth of a cave.  Outside, buzzards squabble over the remains of the giant's feast:  broken barrels, bones picked clean.
element_text: Edward climbs up the last bit of the steep hillside, reaching the mouth of a cave.  Outside, buzzards squabble over the remains of the giant's feast:  broken barrels, bones picked clean.

element: Action: In his most serious voice, Edward calls out:
original_content: In his most serious voice, Edward calls out:
element_text: In his most serious voice, Edward calls out:

element:
Action: EDWARD  (CONT'D)
My name is Edward Bloom!  I want to talk to you!
element_text:
EDWARD  (CONT'D)
My name is Edward Bloom!  I want to talk to you!

element: Action: From deep in a cave, a thunderous voice:
original_content: From deep in a cave, a thunderous voice:
element_text: From deep in a cave, a thunderous voice:

element: Action: The giant's voice has such force, it blows Edward's hair back.
original_content: The giant's voice has such force, it blows Edward's hair back.
element_text: The giant's voice has such force, it blows Edward's hair back.

element: Dialogue: I'm not going anywhere until you show yourself.
original_content: I'm not going anywhere until you show yourself.
element_text: I'm not going anywhere until you show yourself.

element: Action: A beat, then we hear a RUMBLE, like a train coming.  Edward braces himself, fists ready for a fight, if that's what it's going to take.
original_content: A beat, then we hear a RUMBLE, like a train coming.  Edward braces himself, fists ready for a fight, if that's what it's going to take.
element_text: A beat, then we hear a RUMBLE, like a train coming.  Edward braces himself, fists ready for a fight, if that's what it's going to take.

element: Action: As the RUMBLE gets louder, the ground starts to shake.  Even Edward starts to worry.  Just how big is this guy?
original_content: As the RUMBLE gets louder, the ground starts to shake.  Even Edward starts to worry.  Just how big is this guy?
element_text: As the RUMBLE gets louder, the ground starts to shake.  Even Edward starts to worry.  Just how big is this guy?

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)(CONT'D)
Armed with the foreknowledge of my own death, I knew the giant couldn't kill me.  All the same, I preferred to keep my bones unbroken.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)(CONT'D)
Armed with the foreknowledge of my own death, I knew the giant couldn't kill me.  All the same, I preferred to keep my bones unbroken.

element: Action: Edward picks up a stone, ready to play David to Goliath.
original_content: Edward picks up a stone, ready to play David to Goliath.
element_text: Edward picks up a stone, ready to play David to Goliath.

element: Action: Then suddenly, the giant bursts forth.  Hunched over, he slams into a stunned Edward, knocking him halfway down the hill.
original_content: Then suddenly, the giant bursts forth.  Hunched over, he slams into a stunned Edward, knocking him halfway down the hill.
element_text: Then suddenly, the giant bursts forth.  Hunched over, he slams into a stunned Edward, knocking him halfway down the hill.

element: Action: KARL THE GIANT is bigger than any man you've ever seen.  Not just tall, but massive.  He's completely feral, with a beard to his elbow and skin scratched and blistered.  What remains of his clothes are ragged and muddy.  God knows what's living in his matted hair.
original_content: KARL THE GIANT is bigger than any man you've ever seen.  Not just tall, but massive.  He's completely feral, with a beard to his elbow and skin scratched and blistered.  What remains of his clothes are ragged and muddy.  God knows what's living in his matted hair.
element_text: KARL THE GIANT is bigger than any man you've ever seen.  Not just tall, but massive.  He's completely feral, with a beard to his elbow and skin scratched and blistered.  What remains of his clothes are ragged and muddy.  God knows what's living in his matted hair.

element: Action: Karl leans over Edward, blocking the sun.  Edward throws his rock, but it just bounces off.  The giant didn't even notice it.
original_content: Karl leans over Edward, blocking the sun.  Edward throws his rock, but it just bounces off.  The giant didn't even notice it.
element_text: Karl leans over Edward, blocking the sun.  Edward throws his rock, but it just bounces off.  The giant didn't even notice it.

element: Action: Edward ponders the best response, settling on...
original_content: Edward ponders the best response, settling on...
element_text: Edward ponders the best response, settling on...

element: Dialogue: So you can eat me.  The town decided to send a human sacrifice, and I volunteered.
original_content: So you can eat me.  The town decided to send a human sacrifice, and I volunteered.
element_text: So you can eat me.  The town decided to send a human sacrifice, and I volunteered.

element: Action: Karl's eyes narrow, confused.  Edward stands up.
original_content: Karl's eyes narrow, confused.  Edward stands up.
element_text: Karl's eyes narrow, confused.  Edward stands up.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
My arms are a little stringy, but there's some good eating on my legs.  I mean, I'd be tempted to eat them myself.
(beat)
So I guess, just, if you could get it over with quick.  Because I'm not much for pain, really.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
My arms are a little stringy, but there's some good eating on my legs.  I mean, I'd be tempted to eat them myself.
(beat)
So I guess, just, if you could get it over with quick.  Because I'm not much for pain, really.

element: Action: Edward closes his eyes, hands at his side, ready to be eaten.  Karl just stares at him, not sure what to do.
original_content: Edward closes his eyes, hands at his side, ready to be eaten.  Karl just stares at him, not sure what to do.
element_text: Edward closes his eyes, hands at his side, ready to be eaten.  Karl just stares at him, not sure what to do.

element: Action: After a beat, Edward opens his eyes a tiny bit, just to see what the giant is doing.  Relieved to see he's not licking his chops --
original_content: After a beat, Edward opens his eyes a tiny bit, just to see what the giant is doing.  Relieved to see he's not licking his chops --
element_text: After a beat, Edward opens his eyes a tiny bit, just to see what the giant is doing.  Relieved to see he's not licking his chops --

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Look, I can't go back.  I'm a human sacrifice.  If I go back, everyone will think I'm a coward.  And I'd rather be dinner than a coward.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
Look, I can't go back.  I'm a human sacrifice.  If I go back, everyone will think I'm a coward.  And I'd rather be dinner than a coward.

element: Action: Karl sits down with a BOOM, dejected.
original_content: Karl sits down with a BOOM, dejected.
element_text: Karl sits down with a BOOM, dejected.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Here, start with my hand.  It'll be an appetizer.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
Here, start with my hand.  It'll be an appetizer.

element: Action: Reaching up, Edward shoves his hand into Karl's mouth.  But the giant spits it back out.
original_content: Reaching up, Edward shoves his hand into Karl's mouth.  But the giant spits it back out.
element_text: Reaching up, Edward shoves his hand into Karl's mouth.  But the giant spits it back out.

element: Dialogue: I don't want to eat you.  I don't want to eat anybody.  It's just I get so hungry.  I'm too big.
original_content: I don't want to eat you.  I don't want to eat anybody.  It's just I get so hungry.  I'm too big.
element_text: I don't want to eat you.  I don't want to eat anybody.  It's just I get so hungry.  I'm too big.

element: Action: And that's the sad truth.  Karl is less a monster than a freak -- a giant man, but in the end, just a man.
original_content: And that's the sad truth.  Karl is less a monster than a freak -- a giant man, but in the end, just a man.
element_text: And that's the sad truth.  Karl is less a monster than a freak -- a giant man, but in the end, just a man.

element: Action: Edward takes a seat beside him.
original_content: Edward takes a seat beside him.
element_text: Edward takes a seat beside him.

element: Dialogue: Did you ever think maybe you're not too big?  Maybe this town's just too small.  I mean, look at it.
original_content: Did you ever think maybe you're not too big?  Maybe this town's just too small.  I mean, look at it.
element_text: Did you ever think maybe you're not too big?  Maybe this town's just too small.  I mean, look at it.

element: Action: Circling behind them, we look down at Ashton -- a tiny town in a tiny valley.
original_content: Circling behind them, we look down at Ashton -- a tiny town in a tiny valley.
element_text: Circling behind them, we look down at Ashton -- a tiny town in a tiny valley.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Hardly two stories in the whole place.  Now I've heard in real cities, they've got buildings so tall you can't even see the tops of 'em.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
Hardly two stories in the whole place.  Now I've heard in real cities, they've got buildings so tall you can't even see the tops of 'em.

element: Dialogue: Wouldn't lie to you.  And they've got all-you-can-eat buffets.  You can eat a lot, can't you?
original_content: Wouldn't lie to you.  And they've got all-you-can-eat buffets.  You can eat a lot, can't you?
element_text: Wouldn't lie to you.  And they've got all-you-can-eat buffets.  You can eat a lot, can't you?

element: Dialogue: So why are you wasting your time in a small town?  You're a big man.  You should be in the big city.
original_content: So why are you wasting your time in a small town?  You're a big man.  You should be in the big city.
element_text: So why are you wasting your time in a small town?  You're a big man.  You should be in the big city.

element: Action: Karl smiles, but then it fades.  A certain sad suspicion --
original_content: Karl smiles, but then it fades.  A certain sad suspicion --
element_text: Karl smiles, but then it fades.  A certain sad suspicion --

element: Dialogue: You're just trying to get me to leave, aren't you?  That's why they sent you here.
original_content: You're just trying to get me to leave, aren't you?  That's why they sent you here.
element_text: You're just trying to get me to leave, aren't you?  That's why they sent you here.

element: Dialogue: Mine's Edward.  And truthfully, I do want you to leave, Karl.  But I want to leave with you.
original_content: Mine's Edward.  And truthfully, I do want you to leave, Karl.  But I want to leave with you.
element_text: Mine's Edward.  And truthfully, I do want you to leave, Karl.  But I want to leave with you.

element: Dialogue: You think this town is too small for you, well, it's too small for a man of my ambition.  I can't see staying here a day longer.
original_content: You think this town is too small for you, well, it's too small for a man of my ambition.  I can't see staying here a day longer.
element_text: You think this town is too small for you, well, it's too small for a man of my ambition.  I can't see staying here a day longer.

element: Dialogue: I love every square inch of it.  But I can feel the edges closing in on me.  A man's life can only grow to a certain size in a place like this.
original_content: I love every square inch of it.  But I can feel the edges closing in on me.  A man's life can only grow to a certain size in a place like this.
element_text: I love every square inch of it.  But I can feel the edges closing in on me.  A man's life can only grow to a certain size in a place like this.

element: Dialogue: So what do you say?  Join me?
original_content: So what do you say?  Join me?
element_text: So what do you say?  Join me?

element: Action: Karl thinks a moment.  Then --

Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Now first, we gotta get you ready for the city.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
Now first, we gotta get you ready for the city.

element: Action: IN A SINGLE SHOT, Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers, while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent to make him a shirt.
original_content: IN A SINGLE SHOT, Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers, while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent to make him a shirt.
element_text: IN A SINGLE SHOT, Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers, while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent to make him a shirt.

element: Scene Heading: MAIN STREET OF ASHTON - DAY
original_content: EXT.  MAIN STREET OF ASHTON - DAY

element: Action: Spirits buoyed by the high school MARCHING BAND, all the good CITIZENS of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl.  There's a few tears amid the familiar faces.
original_content: Spirits buoyed by the high school MARCHING BAND, all the good CITIZENS of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl.  There's a few tears amid the familiar faces.
element_text: Spirits buoyed by the high school MARCHING BAND, all the good CITIZENS of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl.  There's a few tears amid the familiar faces.

element: Dialogue: Edward Bloom, first son of Ashton, it's with a heavy heart we see you go.  But take with you this Key to the City, and know that any time you want to come back, all our doors are open to you.
original_content: Edward Bloom, first son of Ashton, it's with a heavy heart we see you go.  But take with you this Key to the City, and know that any time you want to come back, all our doors are open to you.
element_text: Edward Bloom, first son of Ashton, it's with a heavy heart we see you go.  But take with you this Key to the City, and know that any time you want to come back, all our doors are open to you.

element: Action: Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor can put the key around his neck.  The crowd CHEERS.  And with that, Edward and Karl start walking, waving as they go.
original_content: Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor can put the key around his neck.  The crowd CHEERS.  And with that, Edward and Karl start walking, waving as they go.
element_text: Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor can put the key around his neck.  The crowd CHEERS.  And with that, Edward and Karl start walking, waving as they go.

element: Action: Only DON PRICE, smoking on the corner, isn't sad to see Edward go.  He crushes his cigarette under his heel.  He wishes he could crush Edward.
original_content: Only DON PRICE, smoking on the corner, isn't sad to see Edward go.  He crushes his cigarette under his heel.  He wishes he could crush Edward.
element_text: Only DON PRICE, smoking on the corner, isn't sad to see Edward go.  He crushes his cigarette under his heel.  He wishes he could crush Edward.

element: Action: Many of the townfolk come onto the street to hug Edward or shake his hand.
original_content: Many of the townfolk come onto the street to hug Edward or shake his hand.
element_text: Many of the townfolk come onto the street to hug Edward or shake his hand.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
That afternoon as I left Ashton, everyone seemed to have advice.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
That afternoon as I left Ashton, everyone seemed to have advice.

element: Dialogue: Find yourself a nice girl!  Don't trust anyone in Kentucky!  Watch your pride, Edward Bloom!
original_content: Find yourself a nice girl!  Don't trust anyone in Kentucky!  Watch your pride, Edward Bloom!
element_text: Find yourself a nice girl!  Don't trust anyone in Kentucky!  Watch your pride, Edward Bloom!

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
But there was one person whose counsel I held above all others.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
But there was one person whose counsel I held above all others.

element: Action: As the crowd parts, he finds himself face to face with
original_content: As the crowd parts, he finds himself face to face with
element_text: As the crowd parts, he finds himself face to face with

element: Action: The ruckus slows and quiets, as if a strange spell has been cast.  She motions for Edward to lean down, so she can whisper something to him.  Although we're VERY CLOSE, we can't hear her voice.
original_content: The ruckus slows and quiets, as if a strange spell has been cast.  She motions for Edward to lean down, so she can whisper something to him.  Although we're VERY CLOSE, we can't hear her voice.
element_text: The ruckus slows and quiets, as if a strange spell has been cast.  She motions for Edward to lean down, so she can whisper something to him.  Although we're VERY CLOSE, we can't hear her voice.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
She said that the biggest fish in the river gets that way by never being caught.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
She said that the biggest fish in the river gets that way by never being caught.

element: Action: The advice only succeeds in confusing Edward.
original_content: The advice only succeeds in confusing Edward.
element_text: The advice only succeeds in confusing Edward.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
(to the Old Woman)
Okay.  Thanks.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
(to the Old Woman)
Okay.  Thanks.

element: Action: Edward and Karl keep walking.  The Old Woman shuffles off, somehow knowing her advice will go unheeded.
original_content: Edward and Karl keep walking.  The Old Woman shuffles off, somehow knowing her advice will go unheeded.
element_text: Edward and Karl keep walking.  The Old Woman shuffles off, somehow knowing her advice will go unheeded.

element: Action: We TILT UP from the road to reveal Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton.  Each wears a backpack with all his earthly possessions.
original_content: We TILT UP from the road to reveal Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton.  Each wears a backpack with all his earthly possessions.
element_text: We TILT UP from the road to reveal Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton.  Each wears a backpack with all his earthly possessions.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
There were two roads out of Ashton, a new one which was paved, and an older one that wasn't.  People didn't use the old road anymore, and it had developed the reputation of being haunted.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
There were two roads out of Ashton, a new one which was paved, and an older one that wasn't.  People didn't use the old road anymore, and it had developed the reputation of being haunted.

element: Action: Edward and Karl come to a bend, where the paved road veers left and an overgrown dirt road runs straight.  The old road is blocked with signs and warnings of danger.
original_content: Edward and Karl come to a bend, where the paved road veers left and an overgrown dirt road runs straight.  The old road is blocked with signs and warnings of danger.
element_text: Edward and Karl come to a bend, where the paved road veers left and an overgrown dirt road runs straight.  The old road is blocked with signs and warnings of danger.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Since I had no intention of ever returning to Ashton, this seemed as good a time as any to find out what lay down that old road.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Since I had no intention of ever returning to Ashton, this seemed as good a time as any to find out what lay down that old road.

element: Action: Karl looks at the dirt road, wary.
original_content: Karl looks at the dirt road, wary.
element_text: Karl looks at the dirt road, wary.

element: Dialogue: You know anyone's who's taken it?
original_content: You know anyone's who's taken it?
element_text: You know anyone's who's taken it?

element: Dialogue: That poet, Norther Winslow did.  He was going to Paris, France.  He must have liked it, because no one ever heard from him again.
original_content: That poet, Norther Winslow did.  He was going to Paris, France.  He must have liked it, because no one ever heard from him again.
element_text: That poet, Norther Winslow did.  He was going to Paris, France.  He must have liked it, because no one ever heard from him again.

element: Dialogue: Tell you what.  You take the other way and I'll cut through here.  Meet you on the far side.
original_content: Tell you what.  You take the other way and I'll cut through here.  Meet you on the far side.
element_text: Tell you what.  You take the other way and I'll cut through here.  Meet you on the far side.

element: Dialogue: You're not trying to run away?
original_content: You're not trying to run away?
element_text: You're not trying to run away?

element: Dialogue: Just to be sure, you can take my pack.
original_content: Just to be sure, you can take my pack.
element_text: Just to be sure, you can take my pack.

element: Action: Karl perks up, even though it means more for him to carry.
original_content: Karl perks up, even though it means more for him to carry.
element_text: Karl perks up, even though it means more for him to carry.

element: Action: The road is overgrown, but not altogether creepy.  The sun is still shining, and the birds still CHIRPING.
original_content: The road is overgrown, but not altogether creepy.  The sun is still shining, and the birds still CHIRPING.
element_text: The road is overgrown, but not altogether creepy.  The sun is still shining, and the birds still CHIRPING.

element: Action: Spinning the Key to the City, Edward WHISTLES, because it's a day meant for whistling.

element: Dialogue: I have to leave.  Tonight.
Dialogue: This town is everything a man could ask for.  And if I were to end up here, I'd consider myself lucky.  But the fact is, I'm not ready to end up anywhere.
original_content: This town is everything a man could ask for.  And if I were to end up here, I'd consider myself lucky.  But the fact is, I'm not ready to end up anywhere.

element: Dialogue: How are you gonna make it without your shoes?

element: Dialogue: I suspect it will hurt a lot.
original_content: I suspect it will hurt a lot.
element_text: I suspect it will hurt a lot.

element: Action: And with that, Edward walks down Main Street.  The townspeople stop dancing, disbelieving, some shaking their heads.

element: Action: Poor Edward Bloom's gone crazy.

element: Scene Heading: THE DARK FOREST - NIGHT
Action: VARIOUS SHOTS:   Edward negotiates the thorns in his bare feet.  It's horrible.  Almost unendurable.
original_content: VARIOUS SHOTS:   Edward negotiates the thorns in his bare feet.  It's horrible.  Almost unendurable.
element_text: VARIOUS SHOTS:   Edward negotiates the thorns in his bare feet.  It's horrible.  Almost unendurable.

element: Action: And then it gets worse.
Action: The trees ahead are moving.  At first, it just seems to be the wind blowing the branches, but as we hear the wood CRACKING and GROANING, there's no mistaking it:  they're trying to block him.
original_content: The trees ahead are moving.  At first, it just seems to be the wind blowing the branches, but as we hear the wood CRACKING and GROANING, there's no mistaking it:  they're trying to block him.

element: Action: Snake-like WHITE ROOTS shoot out of the ground, grabbing for his ankles.  He leaps up, kicking off one tree trunk to grab another one's branches.  He swings off, lands and rolls.  Now all the trees are moving to block him, their dark shapes towering over him in the flashes of LIGHTNING.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
As difficult as it was to reach Spectre, I was fated to get there eventually.  After all, no man can avoid reaching the end of his life.

EDWARD (V.O.)
As difficult as it was to reach Spectre, I was fated to get there eventually.  After all, no man can avoid reaching the end of his life.

element: Dialogue: I don't know if you're aware of this, Josephine, but African parrots, in their native home of the Congo -- they speak only French.
original_content: I don't know if you're aware of this, Josephine, but African parrots, in their native home of the Congo -- they speak only French.
element_text: I don't know if you're aware of this, Josephine, but African parrots, in their native home of the Congo -- they speak only French.

element: Action: All three stop to listen.

Dialogue: You're lucky to get four words out of them in English.  But if you were to walk through the jungle, you'd hear them speaking the most elaborate French.  Those parrots talk about everything:  politics, movies, fashion -- everything but religion.

element: Dialogue: Yes.  But that's a different...

element: Dialogue: The problem is, you only see me as your mother, and not as someone's wife.  And I've been his wife longer than I've been your mother.  You can't discount that.

element: Dialogue: I know it's not easy.  Just remember, he didn't choose to be your father and you didn't choose to be his son.  You just ended up together.  You could pick numbers out of a dark bag and it'd be just the same.  If you ask me, it's a wonder parents and children can stand each other at all.

element: Dialogue: I don't usually remember unless they're especially portentous.  You know what that word means, portentous?
original_content: I don't usually remember unless they're especially portentous.  You know what that word means, portentous?
element_text: I don't usually remember unless they're especially portentous.  You know what that word means, portentous?

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Means when you dream about something that's going to happen.
(beat, gathering)
Like one night, I had a dream where this crow came and told me, "Your Aunt is going to die."  I was so scared I woke up my parents.  They told me it was just a dream, to go back to bed.  But the next morning, my Aunt Stacy was dead.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
Means when you dream about something that's going to happen.
(beat, gathering)
Like one night, I had a dream where this crow came and told me, "Your Aunt is going to die."  I was so scared I woke up my parents.  They told me it was just a dream, to go back to bed.  But the next morning, my Aunt Stacy was dead.

element: Dialogue: Terrible for her, but think about me, young boy with that kind of power.  Wasn't three weeks later that the crow came back to me in a dream and said, "Your Grampa is going to die."  Well, I ran right back to my parents.  My father said, no, Gramps is fine, but I could see there was trepidation.  And true enough, that next morning my Grampa was dead.
original_content: Terrible for her, but think about me, young boy with that kind of power.  Wasn't three weeks later that the crow came back to me in a dream and said, "Your Grampa is going to die."  Well, I ran right back to my parents.  My father said, no, Gramps is fine, but I could see there was trepidation.  And true enough, that next morning my Grampa was dead.
element_text: Terrible for her, but think about me, young boy with that kind of power.  Wasn't three weeks later that the crow came back to me in a dream and said, "Your Grampa is going to die."  Well, I ran right back to my parents.  My father said, no, Gramps is fine, but I could see there was trepidation.  And true enough, that next morning my Grampa was dead.

element: Action: He sits up a bit in bed, his strength returning.
original_content: He sits up a bit in bed, his strength returning.
element_text: He sits up a bit in bed, his strength returning.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
For the next couple weeks, I didn't have another dream.  Until one night the crow came back and said, "Your Daddy is going to die."
(beat)
Well, I didn't know what to do.  But finally I told my father.  And he said not to worry, but I could tell he was rattled.  That next day, he wasn't himself, always looking around, waiting for something to drop on his head.  Because the crow didn't tell how it was going to happen, just those words:  your Daddy is going to die.  Well, he went into town early and was gone for a long time.  And when he finally came back, he looked terrible, like he was waiting for the axe to fall all day.  He said to my mother, "Good God.  I just had the worst day of my life."
(beat)
"You think _you've_ had a bad day," she said.  "This morning the milkman dropped dead on the porch!"
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
For the next couple weeks, I didn't have another dream.  Until one night the crow came back and said, "Your Daddy is going to die."
(beat)
Well, I didn't know what to do.  But finally I told my father.  And he said not to worry, but I could tell he was rattled.  That next day, he wasn't himself, always looking around, waiting for something to drop on his head.  Because the crow didn't tell how it was going to happen, just those words:  your Daddy is going to die.  Well, he went into town early and was gone for a long time.  And when he finally came back, he looked terrible, like he was waiting for the axe to fall all day.  He said to my mother, "Good God.  I just had the worst day of my life."
(beat)
"You think _you've_ had a bad day," she said.  "This morning the milkman dropped dead on the porch!"

Dialogue: You don't need a picture.  Just look up handsome in the dictionary.

element: Action: He rolls his eyes, why not.

element:
Action: JOSEPHINE (O.S.) (CONT'D)
I have photos from the wedding to show you.  There's a great one of you and my father.  I had an extra print made.
element_text:
JOSEPHINE (O.S.) (CONT'D)
I have photos from the wedding to show you.  There's a great one of you and my father.  I had an extra print made.

element: Action: Edward grimaces, a flash of pain.  Around others, he's hiding how much it hurts, but alone we can see how bad it is.
original_content: Edward grimaces, a flash of pain.  Around others, he's hiding how much it hurts, but alone we can see how bad it is.

element: Action: He controls his breathing, trying to push through it.

Action: JOSEPHINE (O.S.) (CONT'D)
I want to see pictures of your wedding.  I've never seen any.
element_text:
JOSEPHINE (O.S.) (CONT'D)
I want to see pictures of your wedding.  I've never seen any.

element: Action: She returns with her camera.  Edward smiles, doing a good job masking the pain.

element: Dialogue: That's because we didn't have a wedding.  Your mother-in-law was never supposed to marry me.  She was engaged to somebody else.
original_content: That's because we didn't have a wedding.  Your mother-in-law was never supposed to marry me.  She was engaged to somebody else.

element: Dialogue: Will never told you that?
Dialogue: Probably just as well.  He would have told it wrong anyway.  All the facts and none of the flavor.

element: Dialogue: Oh, so this is a tall tale?

element: Dialogue: Well, it's not a short one.

element_text: Well, it's not a short one.

element: Action: A devilish smile.  Pushing past Edward, we settle on the whirling fan.

element: Action: ...where the second-rate carnival is parked for the moment in an Alabama field.  To the left, we spot Edward, 20-ish, halfway through a bag of peanuts.  He's still carrying the backpack we saw earlier, and scratched up from his trip through Spectre.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
I had just left Ashton, and was on my way to discover my destiny.  Not knowing what that would be exactly, I explored every opportunity that presented itself.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
I had just left Ashton, and was on my way to discover my destiny.  Not knowing what that would be exactly, I explored every opportunity that presented itself.

element: Action: Joining the crowd, he heads into the big-top.

element: Action: A troupe of STILT-WALKING FIREBREATHERS finishes their act to tremendous APPLAUSE.

element: Action: As the performers clear away, the circus' owner-and-ringmaster AMOS CALLOWAY (50) approaches the stands.  He may only be four feet tall, but Amos has a titanic presence.
original_content: As the performers clear away, the circus' owner-and-ringmaster AMOS CALLOWAY (50) approaches the stands.  He may only be four feet tall, but Amos has a titanic presence.

element: Dialogue: Ladies and Gentlemen, you may think you've seen the _unusual_.  You may think you've seen the _bizarre_.  But I've travelled to the five corners of the world, and let me tell you, I've never seen anything like this.
original_content: Ladies and Gentlemen, you may think you've seen the _unusual_.  You may think you've seen the _bizarre_.  But I've travelled to the five corners of the world, and let me tell you, I've never seen anything like this.
element_text: Ladies and Gentlemen, you may think you've seen the _unusual_.  You may think you've seen the _bizarre_.  But I've travelled to the five corners of the world, and let me tell you, I've never seen anything like this.

element: Action: From behind Amos, CARNIES start rolling a massive ball towards the crowd.
original_content: From behind Amos, CARNIES start rolling a massive ball towards the crowd.
element_text: From behind Amos, CARNIES start rolling a massive ball towards the crowd.

element:
Action: AMOS (CONT'D)
When I found this man, he was picking oranges in Florida.  His fellow workers called him El Penumbra -- The Shadow -- because when you were working beside him, he blocked out the daylight.  He could take a whole tree in his hands and shake off the fruit.  I had to pay his crew boss $10,000 just so I could take him with me.
element_text:
AMOS (CONT'D)
When I found this man, he was picking oranges in Florida.  His fellow workers called him El Penumbra -- The Shadow -- because when you were working beside him, he blocked out the daylight.  He could take a whole tree in his hands and shake off the fruit.  I had to pay his crew boss $10,000 just so I could take him with me.

element: Action: Amos comes up to a MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN in the first row, a quieter moment.
original_content: Amos comes up to a MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN in the first row, a quieter moment.
element_text: Amos comes up to a MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN in the first row, a quieter moment.

element:
Action: AMOS (CONT'D)
Not to alarm you, Ma'am.  But if this man wanted to, he could crush your head between his toes.
(she trembles)
But he won't.
(a long beat)
He's not going to hurt her, folks, because he's our own Gentle Giant.  Ladies and Gentlemen, I give you Colossus!
element_text:
AMOS (CONT'D)
Not to alarm you, Ma'am.  But if this man wanted to, he could crush your head between his toes.
(she trembles)
But he won't.
(a long beat)
He's not going to hurt her, folks, because he's our own Gentle Giant.  Ladies and Gentlemen, I give you Colossus!

element: Action: A foot suddenly bursts out from within.  GASPS from the crowd.  That foot is massive.  In the stands, Edward looks closer.  Intrigued.

element: Dialogue: What's his name?  Does he talk?  It's not important.

element: Dialogue: Tell me Karl, have you ever heard of the term  "involuntary servitude?"
original_content: Tell me Karl, have you ever heard of the term  "involuntary servitude?"
element_text: Tell me Karl, have you ever heard of the term  "involuntary servitude?"

element:
Action: AMOS (CONT'D)
Great, great.  That's fantastic.

Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
It was on that night Karl met his destiny.  And I met mine.  Almost.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
It was on that night Karl met his destiny.  And I met mine.  Almost.

element: Scene Heading: BIG TOP - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS

Action: As Amos pulls Karl aside to give him the hard sell, Edward notices a BEAUTIFUL YOUNG WOMAN (16) leaving with her family.  She's wearing a blue dress and hat.  For no good reason, she looks back at Edward.

original_content: The two make eye contact.  And as they do, all motion FREEZES.

element: Action: Only Edward is free to move, winding his way between the frozen bodies, ducking underneath arms to get closer and closer to this woman.
original_content: Only Edward is free to move, winding his way between the frozen bodies, ducking underneath arms to get closer and closer to this woman.
element_text: Only Edward is free to move, winding his way between the frozen bodies, ducking underneath arms to get closer and closer to this woman.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)(CONT'D)
They say when you meet the love of your life, time stops.  And that's true.  What they don't tell you, is that once time starts again, it moves extra fast to catch up.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)(CONT'D)
They say when you meet the love of your life, time stops.  And that's true.  What they don't tell you, is that once time starts again, it moves extra fast to catch up.

element: Action: Suddenly, everything RUSHES.  The crowd becomes a blur, and the young woman is lost in its wake.  Now it's Edward who's frozen, helpless in time.
original_content: Suddenly, everything RUSHES.  The crowd becomes a blur, and the young woman is lost in its wake.  Now it's Edward who's frozen, helpless in time.

element: Dialogue: Hey kid!  Your friend just made himself a star.

element: Action: Amos hands off the contract to a CLOWN.

element: Action: Mr. Soggybottom HONKS his horn, then waddles off.

element: Dialogue: What's the matter with you, kid?  I haven't seen a customer so depressed since the elephant sat on that farmer's wife.
