element:
Action: AMOS (CONT'D)
See!  The big guy likes it.
element_text:
AMOS (CONT'D)
See!  The big guy likes it.

element: Dialogue: I just saw the woman I'm going to marry, I know it.  But then I lost her.
original_content: I just saw the woman I'm going to marry, I know it.  But then I lost her.
element_text: I just saw the woman I'm going to marry, I know it.  But then I lost her.

element: Dialogue: Tough break.  Most men have to get married before they lose their wives.
original_content: Tough break.  Most men have to get married before they lose their wives.
element_text: Tough break.  Most men have to get married before they lose their wives.

element: Dialogue: I'm going to spend the rest of my life looking for her.  That or die alone.
original_content: I'm going to spend the rest of my life looking for her.  That or die alone.
element_text: I'm going to spend the rest of my life looking for her.  That or die alone.

element: Dialogue: Let me guess.  Real pretty, blonde hair, blue hat?
original_content: Let me guess.  Real pretty, blonde hair, blue hat?
element_text: Let me guess.  Real pretty, blonde hair, blue hat?

element: Dialogue: I know her uncle.  Friends of the family.
original_content: I know her uncle.  Friends of the family.
element_text: I know her uncle.  Friends of the family.

element: Dialogue: Who is she?  Where does she live?
original_content: Who is she?  Where does she live?
element_text: Who is she?  Where does she live?

element: Dialogue: Kid.  Don't waste your time.  She's out of your league.
original_content: Kid.  Don't waste your time.  She's out of your league.
element_text: Kid.  Don't waste your time.  She's out of your league.

element: Action: As Amos starts to walk away, Edward hurries to catch up with him.  Karl follows as well.
original_content: As Amos starts to walk away, Edward hurries to catch up with him.  Karl follows as well.
element_text: As Amos starts to walk away, Edward hurries to catch up with him.  Karl follows as well.

element: Dialogue: What do you mean?  You don't even know me.
original_content: What do you mean?  You don't even know me.
element_text: What do you mean?  You don't even know me.

element: Dialogue: Sure I do.  You were hot shit back in Hickville, but here in the real world, you got squat. You don't have a plan.  You don't have a job.  You don't have anything but the clothes on your back.
original_content: Sure I do.  You were hot shit back in Hickville, but here in the real world, you got squat. You don't have a plan.  You don't have a job.  You don't have anything but the clothes on your back.

element: Dialogue: I've got a whole backpack _full_ of clothes!
original_content: I've got a whole backpack _full_ of clothes!
element_text: I've got a whole backpack _full_ of clothes!

element: Action: He points to the bleachers, where no backpack is to be found.
original_content: He points to the bleachers, where no backpack is to be found.
element_text: He points to the bleachers, where no backpack is to be found.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
(realizing)
Someone stole my backpack.
Dialogue: Kid, you were a big fish in a small pond.  This here is the ocean, and you're drowning.  Take my advice and go back to Puddleville.  You'll be happy there.
original_content: Kid, you were a big fish in a small pond.  This here is the ocean, and you're drowning.  Take my advice and go back to Puddleville.  You'll be happy there.

element: Action: Getting in front of Amos, Edward stops him.
original_content: Getting in front of Amos, Edward stops him.
element_text: Getting in front of Amos, Edward stops him.

element: Dialogue: Wait.  You said I don't have a plan.  I do.  I'm going to find that girl and marry her and spend the rest of my life with her.
original_content: Wait.  You said I don't have a plan.  I do.  I'm going to find that girl and marry her and spend the rest of my life with her.
element_text: Wait.  You said I don't have a plan.  I do.  I'm going to find that girl and marry her and spend the rest of my life with her.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
I don't have a job, but I would have a job if you gave me one.  And I may not have much, but I have more determination than any man you're ever going to meet.
element_text:
EDWARD (CONT'D)
I don't have a job, but I would have a job if you gave me one.  And I may not have much, but I have more determination than any man you're ever going to meet.

element: Dialogue: Sorry, kid.  I don't do charity.
original_content: Sorry, kid.  I don't do charity.
element_text: Sorry, kid.  I don't do charity.

element: Dialogue: I'll work night and day, and you won't have to pay me.  You just have to tell me who she is.
original_content: I'll work night and day, and you won't have to pay me.  You just have to tell me who she is.
element_text: I'll work night and day, and you won't have to pay me.  You just have to tell me who she is.

element: Action: Amos takes a long look at him.  Ultimately, there's no way he can say no.  He shrugs.  What the hell.
original_content: Amos takes a long look at him.  Ultimately, there's no way he can say no.  He shrugs.  What the hell.
element_text: Amos takes a long look at him.  Ultimately, there's no way he can say no.  He shrugs.  What the hell.

element: Dialogue: Every month you work for me, I'll tell you one thing about her.  That's my final offer.
original_content: Every month you work for me, I'll tell you one thing about her.  That's my final offer.
element_text: Every month you work for me, I'll tell you one thing about her.  That's my final offer.

element: Action: CLOSE ON Edward, smiling nervously.  His head is tilted to the side, and as we PULL BACK, we see why:  he's holding it in a MASSIVE LION's open mouth.  The beast's sharp teeth are just poking his skin.  If the lion so much as flinches, Edward is dead.
original_content: CLOSE ON Edward, smiling nervously.  His head is tilted to the side, and as we PULL BACK, we see why:  he's holding it in a MASSIVE LION's open mouth.  The beast's sharp teeth are just poking his skin.  If the lion so much as flinches, Edward is dead.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
From that moment on, I did everything Mr. Calloway asked, and a lot of things he didn't.  I'd go three days without stopping to eat, and four days without sleeping.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
From that moment on, I did everything Mr. Calloway asked, and a lot of things he didn't.  I'd go three days without stopping to eat, and four days without sleeping.

element: Action: His eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride.
original_content: His eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride.
element_text: His eyes droopy from lack of sleep, Edward mans the whirling amusement park ride.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
The only thing that kept me going was the promise of meeting the girl who would be my wife.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
The only thing that kept me going was the promise of meeting the girl who would be my wife.

element: Action: Nodding off, Edward falls backward, into the path of the spinning arms.  One of the Hydra cars hits him square in the gut, throwing him up and away, sailing 200 feet through the air.

Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
Over the months, I learned a lot about the woman I was going to marry, but not her name, and not where to find her.  That time had come.  I couldn't wait any longer.

Action: EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
It was that night I discovered that most things you consider evil or wicked are simply lonely, and lacking in the social niceties.

Dialogue: A few rabbits, but I think one of them was already dead.

element: Dialogue: That would explain the indigestion.

element:
Action: AMOS (CONT'D)
I was wrong about you kid.  You may not have much, but what you got, you got a lot of.  You could get any girl.
element_text:
AMOS (CONT'D)
I was wrong about you kid.  You may not have much, but what you got, you got a lot of.  You could get any girl.

element: Dialogue: There's only one I want.
Dialogue: Her name is Sandra Templeton.  She's going to Auburn.  The semester's almost over, so you better hurry.

After saying my goodbyes, I hopped three trains to get to Auburn that afternoon.

element: Action: Finally, a decision is reached.  The door opens to reveal the woman of Edward's dreams, Sandra Kay Templeton.  She's effortlessly beautiful, pure and simple as sunlight.
original_content: Finally, a decision is reached.  The door opens to reveal the woman of Edward's dreams, Sandra Kay Templeton.  She's effortlessly beautiful, pure and simple as sunlight.

element: Action: He can't believe he's finally reached her.  He half-laughs, nervous.  That makes her laugh, not sure what's going on.
original_content: He can't believe he's finally reached her.  He half-laughs, nervous.  That makes her laugh, not sure what's going on.
element_text: He can't believe he's finally reached her.  He half-laughs, nervous.  That makes her laugh, not sure what's going on.

element: Dialogue: You don't know me, but my name is Edward Bloom and I am in love with you.  I've spent the last three years working to find out who you are.  I've been shot and stabbed and trampled a few times, had my ribs broken twice, but it's all worth it to see you here, now, and to finally get to talk to you.  Because I am destined to marry you.  I knew that from the first moment I saw you at the circus.  And I know it now more than ever.
original_content: You don't know me, but my name is Edward Bloom and I am in love with you.  I've spent the last three years working to find out who you are.  I've been shot and stabbed and trampled a few times, had my ribs broken twice, but it's all worth it to see you here, now, and to finally get to talk to you.  Because I am destined to marry you.  I knew that from the first moment I saw you at the circus.  And I know it now more than ever.
element_text: You don't know me, but my name is Edward Bloom and I am in love with you.  I've spent the last three years working to find out who you are.  I've been shot and stabbed and trampled a few times, had my ribs broken twice, but it's all worth it to see you here, now, and to finally get to talk to you.  Because I am destined to marry you.  I knew that from the first moment I saw you at the circus.  And I know it now more than ever.

original_content: ON SANDRA, overwhelmed.  All she can finally think of to say is...
element_text: ON SANDRA, overwhelmed.  All she can finally think of to say is...

element: Dialogue: Don't need to apologize to me.  I mean, I'm the luckiest person you're going to find today...
original_content: Don't need to apologize to me.  I mean, I'm the luckiest person you're going to find today...
element_text: Don't need to apologize to me.  I mean, I'm the luckiest person you're going to find today...

original_content: She puts her hand on the door frame.  On her left ring finger, we see a diamond.

element: Dialogue: No I'm sorry, I...I'm engaged to be married.
original_content: No I'm sorry, I...I'm engaged to be married.
element_text: No I'm sorry, I...I'm engaged to be married.

element: Action: ON EDWARD as his heart falls 20 floors.  He tries to suppress the reaction, put on a brave front.
original_content: ON EDWARD as his heart falls 20 floors.  He tries to suppress the reaction, put on a brave front.
element_text: ON EDWARD as his heart falls 20 floors.  He tries to suppress the reaction, put on a brave front.

element: Dialogue: But you're wrong.  I _do_ know you, at least by reputation.  Edward Bloom from Ashton.  See, I'm actually engaged to a boy from Ashton.  Don Price.  He was a few years older than you.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
Fate has a cruel way of circling around on you.  After all this work to leave Ashton, the girl I loved was now engaged to one of its biggest jerks.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
Fate has a cruel way of circling around on you.  After all this work to leave Ashton, the girl I loved was now engaged to one of its biggest jerks.

element: Action: He EXITS FRAME, leaving only the sorority house in the background.
original_content: He EXITS FRAME, leaving only the sorority house in the background.
element_text: He EXITS FRAME, leaving only the sorority house in the background.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
There's a time when a man needs to fight, and a time when he needs to accept that his destiny is lost, that the ship has sailed, and that only a fool would continue.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
There's a time when a man needs to fight, and a time when he needs to accept that his destiny is lost, that the ship has sailed, and that only a fool would continue.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
The truth is, I've always been a fool.

EDWARD (V.O.) (CONT'D)
The truth is, I've always been a fool.

Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
Sandra Templeton!  I love you!  And I am going to marry you!

EDWARD (CONT'D)

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
A hitch in the Army was up to three years at that point, and having waited three years just to meet Sandra, I knew I couldn't survive being away from her that long.  So I took every hazardous assignment I could find, with the hope of getting my time down to less than a year.

A hitch in the Army was up to three years at that point, and having waited three years just to meet Sandra, I knew I couldn't survive being away from her that long.  So I took every hazardous assignment I could find, with the hope of getting my time down to less than a year.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
Over the next hour, I described my love for Sandra Kay Templeton, and the ordeal that brought me before them.  As it had always been, this love was my salvation.  It was destined to be.

EDWARD (V.O.)
Over the next hour, I described my love for Sandra Kay Templeton, and the ordeal that brought me before them.  As it had always been, this love was my salvation.  It was destined to be.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
After four months, Sandra had gotten over the worst of the nightmares.  When the phone rang, she didn't think it was somehow me calling her.  When a car drove past, she didn't get up to check out the window.

EDWARD (V.O.)
After four months, Sandra had gotten over the worst of the nightmares.  When the phone rang, she didn't think it was somehow me calling her.  When a car drove past, she didn't get up to check out the window.

element: Dialogue: You never told me how your parents met.

element: Dialogue: What about the details?  How they fell in love.  The Circus.  The War.  You never told me any of that.

element: Dialogue: That's because most of it never happened.

element: Dialogue: Do you love your father?
Dialogue: Everyone loves my father.  He's a very likeable guy.
original_content: Everyone loves my father.  He's a very likeable guy.
element_text: Everyone loves my father.  He's a very likeable guy.

element: Action: Will doesn't want to answer yes or no.
original_content: Will doesn't want to answer yes or no.
element_text: Will doesn't want to answer yes or no.

element: Dialogue: You have to understand.  When I was growing up, he was gone more than he was here.  And I started thinking -- maybe he has a second life somewhere else.  With another house, another family.  He leaves us, he goes to them.  Or maybe there is no family.  Maybe he never wanted a family.  But whatever it is, maybe he likes that second life better.  And the reason he tells all those stories is because he can't stand this boring place.
original_content: You have to understand.  When I was growing up, he was gone more than he was here.  And I started thinking -- maybe he has a second life somewhere else.  With another house, another family.  He leaves us, he goes to them.  Or maybe there is no family.  Maybe he never wanted a family.  But whatever it is, maybe he likes that second life better.  And the reason he tells all those stories is because he can't stand this boring place.
element_text: You have to understand.  When I was growing up, he was gone more than he was here.  And I started thinking -- maybe he has a second life somewhere else.  With another house, another family.  He leaves us, he goes to them.  Or maybe there is no family.  Maybe he never wanted a family.  But whatever it is, maybe he likes that second life better.  And the reason he tells all those stories is because he can't stand this boring place.

element: Dialogue: What is "true?"  I've never heard my father say a single true thing.
original_content: What is "true?"  I've never heard my father say a single true thing.

element: Dialogue: Do you know much about icebergs, Dad?
original_content: Do you know much about icebergs, Dad?
element_text: Do you know much about icebergs, Dad?

element: Dialogue: Do I?  I saw an iceberg once.  They were hauling it down to Texas for drinking water, only they didn't count on an elephant being frozen inside.  The woolly kind.  A mammoth.
original_content: Do I?  I saw an iceberg once.  They were hauling it down to Texas for drinking water, only they didn't count on an elephant being frozen inside.  The woolly kind.  A mammoth.
element_text: Do I?  I saw an iceberg once.  They were hauling it down to Texas for drinking water, only they didn't count on an elephant being frozen inside.  The woolly kind.  A mammoth.

element: Dialogue: I'm trying to make a metaphor here.
original_content: I'm trying to make a metaphor here.
element_text: I'm trying to make a metaphor here.

element: Dialogue: Then you shouldn't have started with a question.  Because people want to answer questions.  You should have started with, "The thing about icebergs is..."
original_content: Then you shouldn't have started with a question.  Because people want to answer questions.  You should have started with, "The thing about icebergs is..."
element_text: Then you shouldn't have started with a question.  Because people want to answer questions.  You should have started with, "The thing about icebergs is..."

element: Dialogue: The thing about icebergs is you only see 10 percent of them.  The other 90 percent is below the water where you can't see it.  And that's what it is with you Dad.  I'm only seeing this little bit that sticks above the water.
original_content: The thing about icebergs is you only see 10 percent of them.  The other 90 percent is below the water where you can't see it.  And that's what it is with you Dad.  I'm only seeing this little bit that sticks above the water.

element: Dialogue: What, you're seeing down to my nose?  My chin?
original_content: What, you're seeing down to my nose?  My chin?
element_text: What, you're seeing down to my nose?  My chin?

element: Dialogue: I have no idea who you are because you have never told me a single fact.
original_content: I have no idea who you are because you have never told me a single fact.
element_text: I have no idea who you are because you have never told me a single fact.

element: Dialogue: I've told you a thousand facts.  That's all I do, Will.  I tell stories.
original_content: I've told you a thousand facts.  That's all I do, Will.  I tell stories.
element_text: I've told you a thousand facts.  That's all I do, Will.  I tell stories.

element: Dialogue: You tell lies, Dad.  You tell amusing lies.  Stories are what you tell a five-year old at bedtime.  They're not elaborate mythologies you maintain when your son is ten and fifteen and twenty and thirty.  And the thing is, I believed you.  I believed your stories so much longer than I should have.  And then when I realized that everything you said was impossible -- everything! -- I felt like such a fool to have trusted you.  You were like Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny combined.  Just as charming and just as fake.
original_content: You tell lies, Dad.  You tell amusing lies.  Stories are what you tell a five-year old at bedtime.  They're not elaborate mythologies you maintain when your son is ten and fifteen and twenty and thirty.  And the thing is, I believed you.  I believed your stories so much longer than I should have.  And then when I realized that everything you said was impossible -- everything! -- I felt like such a fool to have trusted you.  You were like Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny combined.  Just as charming and just as fake.

And then when I realized that everything you said was impossible -- everything! -- I felt like such a fool to have trusted you.  You were like Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny combined.  Just as charming and just as fake.

element: Dialogue: It would kill you, huh?
Dialogue: What do you want, Will?  Who do you want me to be?
original_content: What do you want, Will?  Who do you want me to be?
element_text: What do you want, Will?  Who do you want me to be?

element: Dialogue: Yourself.  Good, bad, everything.  Just show me who you are for once.
original_content: Yourself.  Good, bad, everything.  Just show me who you are for once.
element_text: Yourself.  Good, bad, everything.  Just show me who you are for once.

element: Dialogue: I have been nothing but myself since the day I was born.  And if you can't see that, it's your failing, not mine.

element_text: I have been nothing but myself since the day I was born.  And if you can't see that, it's your failing, not mine.

The storeroom is a museum of hasty decisions and half-finished projects:  partially built outboard motors, dead bonsai trees, Frankensteinian lawnmowers.  We also find boxes of products Edward used to sell.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
After the war, the sons of Alabama returned home, looking for work.  Each had an advantage over me.  They were alive, while I was -- officially -- deceased.

EDWARD (V.O.)
After the war, the sons of Alabama returned home, looking for work.  Each had an advantage over me.  They were alive, while I was -- officially -- deceased.

element: Action: Edward shakes hands with his new boss, a TOUPEED MAN.  The company is called "Confederated Products."  The OFFICE LADIES all love Edward.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
With my prospects few, I took a job as a travelling salesman.  It suited me. If there's one thing you can say about Edward Bloom, it's that I am a social person.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
With my prospects few, I took a job as a travelling salesman.  It suited me. If there's one thing you can say about Edward Bloom, it's that I am a social person.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
Soon I added other products, and other cities, until my territory stretched from the coast to western Texas.

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
I could be gone for weeks at a time.  But every other Friday, I'd put all the money I'd made into an account set aside for a proper house with a white picket fence.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
I could be gone for weeks at a time.  But every other Friday, I'd put all the money I'd made into an account set aside for a proper house with a white picket fence.

element: Action: The man is none other than...

element:
Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
I was astonished to see the greatest poet of both Ashton and Spectre all the way out in Texas.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
I was astonished to see the greatest poet of both Ashton and Spectre all the way out in Texas.

element: Action: The men shake, disbelieving this lucky coincidence.
original_content: The men shake, disbelieving this lucky coincidence.
element_text: The men shake, disbelieving this lucky coincidence.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
I don't believe it!

Dialogue: I want you to know, when you left Spectre it opened my eyes.  There was a whole life out there that I was not living.  So I travelled.  I saw France, and Africa, half of South America.  Every day a new adventure, that's my motto.
original_content: I want you to know, when you left Spectre it opened my eyes.  There was a whole life out there that I was not living.  So I travelled.  I saw France, and Africa, half of South America.  Every day a new adventure, that's my motto.

element: Dialogue: That's great, Norther.  I'm happy for you.  I can't believe I helped.
original_content: That's great, Norther.  I'm happy for you.  I can't believe I helped.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
So what are you up to now?

EDWARD (CONT'D)
So what are you up to now?

Action: NORTHER WINSLOW (CONT'D)
(to the crowd)
Now, I want all of you to lie down.  I'm gonna be cleaning out the cash drawers, and my associate here is going to handle the vault.
(pointing to a Teller Woman)
You help my friend, okay?
element_text:
NORTHER WINSLOW (CONT'D)
(to the crowd)
Now, I want all of you to lie down.  I'm gonna be cleaning out the cash drawers, and my associate here is going to handle the vault.
(pointing to a Teller Woman)
You help my friend, okay?

element: Dialogue: Look, I'm really sorry.  I just don't want anybody to get hurt.

element: Dialogue: It's not that, it's just...

element: Action: The inner sanctum of the Horizon Savings and Loan holds exactly one folding chair.  Nothing else.
original_content: The inner sanctum of the Horizon Savings and Loan holds exactly one folding chair.  Nothing else.

element: Dialogue: ...there's no money.  We're completely bankrupt.

Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
It turned out the savings and loan had already been robbed -- not by armed bandits, but by speculators in Texas real estate.
element_text:
EDWARD (V.O.)
It turned out the savings and loan had already been robbed -- not by armed bandits, but by speculators in Texas real estate.

element: Dialogue: You gotta promise you won't tell anybody.

element: Dialogue: Sixty.  Eighty.  Four hundred dollars!   Not bad for just the drawers.  Let's see what you got from the vault.

element: Action: Edward winces, but doesn't say anything yet.  Digging through the vault bag, Norther is surprised to find only a single deposit envelope.  He rips it open, revealing just a little cash inside.  Even some dimes and pennies.

element: Action: Caught, Edward has to confess...

Action: EDWARD (V.O.)
I told Norther about the vagaries of Texas oil money and its effect on real estate prices, and how lax enforcement of fiduciary process had made savings and loans particularly vulnerable.  Hearing this news, Norther was left with one conclusion:

EDWARD (V.O.)
I told Norther about the vagaries of Texas oil money and its effect on real estate prices, and how lax enforcement of fiduciary process had made savings and loans particularly vulnerable.  Hearing this news, Norther was left with one conclusion:

element_text:
JENNY (CONT'D)
(to the student)
Listen, Kenny.  Why don't we skip the lesson today?  We can go again next week.

element: Action: She hands him five dollars out of her pocket.
original_content: She hands him five dollars out of her pocket.
element_text: She hands him five dollars out of her pocket.

element: Dialogue: Do I have to give it back to my Mom?
original_content: Do I have to give it back to my Mom?
element_text: Do I have to give it back to my Mom?

element: Dialogue: I won't tell her if you won't.
original_content: I won't tell her if you won't.
element_text: I won't tell her if you won't.

element: Action: You don't have to tell him twice.  He's out the door in a flash.
original_content: You don't have to tell him twice.  He's out the door in a flash.
element_text: You don't have to tell him twice.  He's out the door in a flash.

element: Action: While Will sips his iced tea, Jenny flips through a form she never expected to see again.  She hands it back to Will.
original_content: While Will sips his iced tea, Jenny flips through a form she never expected to see again.  She hands it back to Will.
element_text: While Will sips his iced tea, Jenny flips through a form she never expected to see again.  She hands it back to Will.

element: Dialogue: How did you know my father?
original_content: How did you know my father?
element_text: How did you know my father?

element: Dialogue: This was on his sales route, so he was through here all the time.  Everyone in town knew him.
original_content: This was on his sales route, so he was through here all the time.  Everyone in town knew him.
element_text: This was on his sales route, so he was through here all the time.  Everyone in town knew him.

element: Dialogue: Were you and my father having an affair?
original_content: Were you and my father having an affair?
element_text: Were you and my father having an affair?

element: Dialogue: Wow.  Wow, you just said it.  I was expecting to dance around this for another half hour.
original_content: Wow.  Wow, you just said it.  I was expecting to dance around this for another half hour.
element_text: Wow.  Wow, you just said it.  I was expecting to dance around this for another half hour.

element: Dialogue: I've seen him with women.  He flirts.  He always has.  On some level, I presumed he was cheating on my mother.  I just never had proof.
original_content: I've seen him with women.  He flirts.  He always has.  On some level, I presumed he was cheating on my mother.  I just never had proof.
element_text: I've seen him with women.  He flirts.  He always has.  On some level, I presumed he was cheating on my mother.  I just never had proof.

element: Action: She moves, trying to get out of the corner he's boxed her into.  Once she's finally free...
original_content: She moves, trying to get out of the corner he's boxed her into.  Once she's finally free...
element_text: She moves, trying to get out of the corner he's boxed her into.  Once she's finally free...

element: Dialogue: Can I ask you a question?  Why did you come here today?  If you found this deed, why didn't you just ask Eddie?
original_content: Can I ask you a question?  Why did you come here today?  If you found this deed, why didn't you just ask Eddie?
element_text: Can I ask you a question?  Why did you come here today?  If you found this deed, why didn't you just ask Eddie?

element: Action: A long beat.  Jenny is taken back by the suddenness of it.  She's a tangle of conflicting emotions.
original_content: A long beat.  Jenny is taken back by the suddenness of it.  She's a tangle of conflicting emotions.
element_text: A long beat.  Jenny is taken back by the suddenness of it.  She's a tangle of conflicting emotions.

element: Dialogue: Look, I don't know how much you want to know about any of this.  You have one image of your father and it would be wrong for me to go and change it.  Especially this late in the game.
original_content: Look, I don't know how much you want to know about any of this.  You have one image of your father and it would be wrong for me to go and change it.  Especially this late in the game.
element_text: Look, I don't know how much you want to know about any of this.  You have one image of your father and it would be wrong for me to go and change it.  Especially this late in the game.

element: Dialogue: My father talked about a lot of things he never did, and I'm sure he did a lot of things he never talked about.  I'm just trying to reconcile the two.
original_content: My father talked about a lot of things he never did, and I'm sure he did a lot of things he never talked about.  I'm just trying to reconcile the two.
element_text: My father talked about a lot of things he never did, and I'm sure he did a lot of things he never talked about.  I'm just trying to reconcile the two.

element: Action: Fair enough.  Jenny takes a seat across from him at the table.
original_content: Fair enough.  Jenny takes a seat across from him at the table.
element_text: Fair enough.  Jenny takes a seat across from him at the table.

element: Dialogue: The first thing you have to understand, is that your father never meant to end up here.  And yet he did, twice.  The first time, he was early.  The second time, he was late.
original_content: The first thing you have to understand, is that your father never meant to end up here.  And yet he did, twice.  The first time, he was early.  The second time, he was late.
element_text: The first thing you have to understand, is that your father never meant to end up here.  And yet he did, twice.  The first time, he was early.  The second time, he was late.

element: Scene Heading: EDWARD'S CAR / DRIVING - NIGHT
Action: It's late, and Edward is pensive.
original_content: It's late, and Edward is pensive.
element_text: It's late, and Edward is pensive.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
Those days, your father was working for himself.  If there was one thing you could say about Edward Bloom, it's that he was a social person, and people took a liking to him.  One night he was returning from three weeks on the road, when he hit a thunderstorm unlike any in his life.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
Those days, your father was working for himself.  If there was one thing you could say about Edward Bloom, it's that he was a social person, and people took a liking to him.  One night he was returning from three weeks on the road, when he hit a thunderstorm unlike any in his life.

element: Action: The first raindrops hit the windshield.  Edward turns on the wipers.
original_content: The first raindrops hit the windshield.  Edward turns on the wipers.
element_text: The first raindrops hit the windshield.  Edward turns on the wipers.

element: Scene Heading: EDWARD'S CAR - NIGHT - [THE STORM]
Action: Suddenly, a deluge descends.  It's not even rain anymore -- there's no space between the drops.  It's like being caught in a waterfall.  It's that loud.
original_content: Suddenly, a deluge descends.  It's not even rain anymore -- there's no space between the drops.  It's like being caught in a waterfall.  It's that loud.
element_text: Suddenly, a deluge descends.  It's not even rain anymore -- there's no space between the drops.  It's like being caught in a waterfall.  It's that loud.

element: Action: No choice, Edward stops the car.  Puts on the handbrake.  Just as suddenly, the sound changes -- no longer pounding, but softly SPLASHING.  The world is close and echoing, because --
original_content: No choice, Edward stops the car.  Puts on the handbrake.  Just as suddenly, the sound changes -- no longer pounding, but softly SPLASHING.  The world is close and echoing, because --

element: Action: -- the car is underwater.  The tires are still on the road, but where there used to be air is water.
original_content: -- the car is underwater.  The tires are still on the road, but where there used to be air is water.
element_text: -- the car is underwater.  The tires are still on the road, but where there used to be air is water.

element: Action: Three catfish swim in front of his headlights.
original_content: Three catfish swim in front of his headlights.
element_text: Three catfish swim in front of his headlights.

element: Action: Realizing his plight, Edward tries to remain calm.  Water is trickling in through the crack between the window and the door, but very slowly.  For now, he's fine.
original_content: Realizing his plight, Edward tries to remain calm.  Water is trickling in through the crack between the window and the door, but very slowly.  For now, he's fine.
element_text: Realizing his plight, Edward tries to remain calm.  Water is trickling in through the crack between the window and the door, but very slowly.  For now, he's fine.

element: Action: That's when he sees her -- The Girl in the River.
original_content: That's when he sees her -- The Girl in the River.
element_text: That's when he sees her -- The Girl in the River.

element: Action: She's swimming outside the car.  While we never see her face exactly, she remains just as beautiful, just as mysterious, as the first time we saw her.
original_content: She's swimming outside the car.  While we never see her face exactly, she remains just as beautiful, just as mysterious, as the first time we saw her.
element_text: She's swimming outside the car.  While we never see her face exactly, she remains just as beautiful, just as mysterious, as the first time we saw her.

element: Action: She puts her hand to the windshield.  He puts his up to meet hers.  And smiles.

element_text: She puts her hand to the windshield.  He puts his up to meet hers.  And smiles.

element: Action: which balances precariously ten feet up in an elm tree.  As Edward gathers his last pair of socks, he notices a shiny piece of metal sticking out of the dirt.  He pulls it out, rubs it off.

Action: JENNY (V.O.)
Fate has a way of circling back on a man, and taking him by surprise.

Fate has a way of circling back on a man, and taking him by surprise.

original_content: Amazed and disbelieving, Edward walks down the center of the road, no cars coming from either direction.  He looks up to find his faded shoes still dangling from the power line, along with the rest of the town's.

A man sees things differently at different times in his life.  This town didn't seem the same now that he was older.

A man sees things differently at different times in his life.  This town didn't seem the same now that he was older.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
A new road had brought the outside world to Spectre, and with it, banks, liens and debt.  Almost everywhere you looked, people were bankrupt.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
A new road had brought the outside world to Spectre, and with it, banks, liens and debt.  Almost everywhere you looked, people were bankrupt.

element: Action: We slowly MOVE THROUGH a foreclosure auction to find Edward watching.  Two very corporate MEN IN SUITS, stick out among the bidders.
original_content: We slowly MOVE THROUGH a foreclosure auction to find Edward watching.  Two very corporate MEN IN SUITS, stick out among the bidders.
element_text: We slowly MOVE THROUGH a foreclosure auction to find Edward watching.  Two very corporate MEN IN SUITS, stick out among the bidders.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
Two different corporations were looking at buying the town, if they could get the price low enough.   One wanted to open a chicken processing plant.  The other, a municipal dump.  Either way, Spectre would be destroyed.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
Two different corporations were looking at buying the town, if they could get the price low enough.   One wanted to open a chicken processing plant.  The other, a municipal dump.  Either way, Spectre would be destroyed.

element: Action: Everyone turns to look at this new bidder.
original_content: Everyone turns to look at this new bidder.
element_text: Everyone turns to look at this new bidder.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
And so Edward Bloom decided to buy the town, in order to save it.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
And so Edward Bloom decided to buy the town, in order to save it.

element: Scene Heading: NORTHER WINSLOW'S MANHATTAN - DAY
Action: Edward pitches his plan to Norther.
original_content: Edward pitches his plan to Norther.
element_text: Edward pitches his plan to Norther.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
He was never a wealthy man, but he had made other men rich, and now he asked for their favors.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
He was never a wealthy man, but he had made other men rich, and now he asked for their favors.

element: Action: VARIOUS SHOTS:  Expressive and passionate as always, Edward talks to Ping, Jing and Amos Calloway.
original_content: VARIOUS SHOTS:  Expressive and passionate as always, Edward talks to Ping, Jing and Amos Calloway.
element_text: VARIOUS SHOTS:  Expressive and passionate as always, Edward talks to Ping, Jing and Amos Calloway.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
Most of them had never seen Spectre -- they only had Edward's words to describe it.  That's all they needed.  He sold them on the dream.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
Most of them had never seen Spectre -- they only had Edward's words to describe it.  That's all they needed.  He sold them on the dream.

element: Dialogue: You can structure it as a historical trust.  But you'll need every contiguous piece of property.  It's all or nothing.
original_content: You can structure it as a historical trust.  But you'll need every contiguous piece of property.  It's all or nothing.
element_text: You can structure it as a historical trust.  But you'll need every contiguous piece of property.  It's all or nothing.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
So first he bought the farms.  Then he bought the houses.  Then he bought the stores.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
So first he bought the farms.  Then he bought the houses.  Then he bought the stores.

element: Action: Finishing up with AL, Edward shakes hands.
original_content: Finishing up with AL, Edward shakes hands.
element_text: Finishing up with AL, Edward shakes hands.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.)
Whatever he bought, the people were not asked to leave or pay rent or anything.  They were just asked to keep doing as they were doing.  In that way, he could make sure the town would never die.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
Whatever he bought, the people were not asked to leave or pay rent or anything.  They were just asked to keep doing as they were doing.  In that way, he could make sure the town would never die.

original_content: Edward climbs out of his car, the road having literally stopped.  The sun is shining, but it can barely penetrate the trees' thick canopy.

Action: JENNY (V.O.)
Within six months, his trust had purchased the entire town.  With one exception.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)
Within six months, his trust had purchased the entire town.  With one exception.

element: Action: In the distance, he sees a shack, so old it's nearly fallen.  He walks toward it, the marshy ground SQUISHING up around his feet, soaking the hems of his trousers.

element_text: The inside is nicer than you'd think, a real home.  A fire burns in the stove, and curtains hang in the windows.

element: Action: With her back turned to him, Jenny Hill plays the piano.  Edward doesn't recognize her as the little girl who used to have a crush on him.  Without turning, she says...

element: Dialogue: You must be Edward Bloom.
Dialogue: No one would come out here unless they had business.  And no one would have business with me except for you.  You're buying the town.
original_content: No one would come out here unless they had business.  And no one would have business with me except for you.  You're buying the town.
element_text: No one would come out here unless they had business.  And no one would have business with me except for you.  You're buying the town.

element: Dialogue: Apparently I've overlooked this one piece of it, and I'd like to remedy that.  You see, in order for the town to be preserved, the trust must own it in its entirety.
original_content: Apparently I've overlooked this one piece of it, and I'd like to remedy that.  You see, in order for the town to be preserved, the trust must own it in its entirety.
element_text: Apparently I've overlooked this one piece of it, and I'd like to remedy that.  You see, in order for the town to be preserved, the trust must own it in its entirety.

element: Dialogue: I'll offer you more than it's worth.  And you know you won't have to move.  Nothing will change except the name on the deed, you have my word.
original_content: I'll offer you more than it's worth.  And you know you won't have to move.  Nothing will change except the name on the deed, you have my word.
element_text: I'll offer you more than it's worth.  And you know you won't have to move.  Nothing will change except the name on the deed, you have my word.

element: Action: Jenny stops playing, her piece not quite finished.  She turns to face him.  Edward still doesn't recognize her.
original_content: Jenny stops playing, her piece not quite finished.  She turns to face him.  Edward still doesn't recognize her.
element_text: Jenny stops playing, her piece not quite finished.  She turns to face him.  Edward still doesn't recognize her.

element: Dialogue: Now let me get this straight.  You'll buy the swamp from me, but I'll stay in it.  You'll own the house, but it'll still be mine.  I'll be here, and you'll come and go as you please to one place or another.  Do I have that right?
original_content: Now let me get this straight.  You'll buy the swamp from me, but I'll stay in it.  You'll own the house, but it'll still be mine.  I'll be here, and you'll come and go as you please to one place or another.  Do I have that right?

element: Action: Strange to hear it put that way, but --
original_content: Strange to hear it put that way, but --
element_text: Strange to hear it put that way, but --

element: Dialogue: In so many words, yes.
Dialogue: Then I don't think so Mr. Bloom.  If nothing is going to change, I'd just as soon it not change in the way it hasn't been changing all this time.
original_content: Then I don't think so Mr. Bloom.  If nothing is going to change, I'd just as soon it not change in the way it hasn't been changing all this time.
element_text: Then I don't think so Mr. Bloom.  If nothing is going to change, I'd just as soon it not change in the way it hasn't been changing all this time.

element: Dialogue: It's not like you're going to lose anything.  You can ask anyone in town.  I've been nothing if not generous.  I want the best for everyone.
original_content: It's not like you're going to lose anything.  You can ask anyone in town.  I've been nothing if not generous.  I want the best for everyone.
element_text: It's not like you're going to lose anything.  You can ask anyone in town.  I've been nothing if not generous.  I want the best for everyone.

element: Dialogue: Mr. Bloom, why are you buying this land?  Some sort of midlife crisis?  Instead of buying a convertible, you buy a town?
original_content: Mr. Bloom, why are you buying this land?  Some sort of midlife crisis?  Instead of buying a convertible, you buy a town?
element_text: Mr. Bloom, why are you buying this land?  Some sort of midlife crisis?  Instead of buying a convertible, you buy a town?

element: Action: He looks at her, puzzled and surprised.  No one has really asked before.
original_content: He looks at her, puzzled and surprised.  No one has really asked before.
element_text: He looks at her, puzzled and surprised.  No one has really asked before.

element: Dialogue: Helping people makes me happy.
Dialogue: I'm not convinced you should be happy.
original_content: I'm not convinced you should be happy.
element_text: I'm not convinced you should be happy.

element: Dialogue: I'm sorry.  Have I offended you?
original_content: I'm sorry.  Have I offended you?

element: Action: She finally turns to face him.
original_content: She finally turns to face him.
element_text: She finally turns to face him.

element: Dialogue: No, you did exactly what you promised.  You came back.  I was just expecting you sooner.
original_content: No, you did exactly what you promised.  You came back.  I was just expecting you sooner.
element_text: No, you did exactly what you promised.  You came back.  I was just expecting you sooner.

original_content: Finally realizing who this woman is...

element_text: She's dead serious.  Weighing the scales of chivalry, he finally backs away.  Turns and heads back towards his car.

element: Action: We STAY ON Jenny, watching him go.  She's furious, but there's something more in her feelings for him.  Something softer.
original_content: We STAY ON Jenny, watching him go.  She's furious, but there's something more in her feelings for him.  Something softer.
element_text: We STAY ON Jenny, watching him go.  She's furious, but there's something more in her feelings for him.  Something softer.

element:
Action: JENNY (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Most men in that situation would accept their failure and move on.  But Edward was not like most men.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Most men in that situation would accept their failure and move on.  But Edward was not like most men.

As the months passed, he found more and more things to fix, until the shack no longer resembled itself.

As the months passed, he found more and more things to fix, until the shack no longer resembled itself.

element: Action: we saw before.  It's tiny and white, with black shutters and a steep roof.  A white picket fence.  In every detail it is impossibly charming.
original_content: we saw before.  It's tiny and white, with black shutters and a steep roof.  A white picket fence.  In every detail it is impossibly charming.
element_text: we saw before.  It's tiny and white, with black shutters and a steep roof.  A white picket fence.  In every detail it is impossibly charming.

element: Action: Edward is screwing a hat rack into the wall in the foyer.  Jenny leans against the doorframe listening to his story.  And watching him with deepest affection.
original_content: Edward is screwing a hat rack into the wall in the foyer.  Jenny leans against the doorframe listening to his story.  And watching him with deepest affection.

element: Dialogue: Of course, the best part was creating new material.  By the time the twins and I got to Havana, we had a whole new routine worked out for them, with just a ukulele and a harmonica.
original_content: Of course, the best part was creating new material.  By the time the twins and I got to Havana, we had a whole new routine worked out for them, with just a ukulele and a harmonica.

element: Action: Finished with his work, he takes his hat off the chair and hangs it on the rack.  Perfect.
original_content: Finished with his work, he takes his hat off the chair and hangs it on the rack.  Perfect.
element_text: Finished with his work, he takes his hat off the chair and hangs it on the rack.  Perfect.

element: Action: A beat.  A look between them.  With that last job done, there's no reason for him to be staying any longer.
original_content: A beat.  A look between them.  With that last job done, there's no reason for him to be staying any longer.
element_text: A beat.  A look between them.  With that last job done, there's no reason for him to be staying any longer.

element:
Action: EDWARD (CONT'D)
I suppose I should...
Action: He takes his hat off the rack.
original_content: He takes his hat off the rack.
element_text: He takes his hat off the rack.

element: Dialogue: You can leave it there.
Action: A beat.  Does she really mean it?
original_content: A beat.  Does she really mean it?
element_text: A beat.  Does she really mean it?

element: Action: She comes closer.  Edward holds his ground.  She takes his hand, lifting his hat up to the peg.  She's very close -- just a half-inch from kissing him when --
original_content: She comes closer.  Edward holds his ground.  She takes his hand, lifting his hat up to the peg.  She's very close -- just a half-inch from kissing him when --
element_text: She comes closer.  Edward holds his ground.  She takes his hand, lifting his hat up to the peg.  She's very close -- just a half-inch from kissing him when --

element: Action: -- Edward gently holds her back.
Action: She freezes, stunned and humiliated.  She pulls away.
original_content: She freezes, stunned and humiliated.  She pulls away.
element_text: She freezes, stunned and humiliated.  She pulls away.

element:
Action: EDWARD  (CONT'D)
Don't.  Don't be embarrassed.  I should never have let you think that...
(beat)
I am in love with my wife.
element_text:
EDWARD  (CONT'D)
Don't.  Don't be embarrassed.  I should never have let you think that...
(beat)
I am in love with my wife.

element: Dialogue: And from the moment I saw her until the moment I die, she's the only one.
original_content: And from the moment I saw her until the moment I die, she's the only one.
element_text: And from the moment I saw her until the moment I die, she's the only one.

element: Dialogue: I'm sorry, Jenny.  I am.
Action: With that, he begins to leaves.
original_content: With that, he begins to leaves.
element_text: With that, he begins to leaves.

element: Action: She finds a pen and hastily signs the deed to the house.  Hands it to him.  With a look, he thanks her.  Then goes.
original_content: She finds a pen and hastily signs the deed to the house.  Hands it to him.  With a look, he thanks her.  Then goes.
element_text: She finds a pen and hastily signs the deed to the house.  Hands it to him.  With a look, he thanks her.  Then goes.

element: Action: Edward takes a final look at this perfect little town.
original_content: Edward takes a final look at this perfect little town.
element_text: Edward takes a final look at this perfect little town.

Action: JENNY (V.O.)
One day, Edward Bloom left, and never returned to the town he'd saved.

One day, Edward Bloom left, and never returned to the town he'd saved.

element:

As for the girl, the common belief was that she'd become a witch, and crazy at that.  She became something of a legend herself.
element_text:
JENNY (V.O.)(CONT'D)
As for the girl, the common belief was that she'd become a witch, and crazy at that.  She became something of a legend herself.

element: Action: We REVERSE to find FOUR KIDS looking in through the rusty iron gate with flashlights.  A beat, then they run away.

And the story ended where it began.

original_content: INT.  JENNY HILL'S KITCHEN - PRESENT DAY

element: Action: Will and Jenny are still sitting at her table, a pitcher of iced tea between them.
original_content: Will and Jenny are still sitting at her table, a pitcher of iced tea between them.
element_text: Will and Jenny are still sitting at her table, a pitcher of iced tea between them.

element: Dialogue: Logically, you couldn't be the Witch, because she was old back when he was young.
original_content: Logically, you couldn't be the Witch, because she was old back when he was young.
element_text: Logically, you couldn't be the Witch, because she was old back when he was young.

element: Dialogue: No, it's logical if you think like your father.  See, to him, there's only two women:  your mother and everyone else.
original_content: No, it's logical if you think like your father.  See, to him, there's only two women:  your mother and everyone else.
element_text: No, it's logical if you think like your father.  See, to him, there's only two women:  your mother and everyone else.

element: Dialogue: Well, therapy.  And one day I realized I was in love with a man who could never love me back.  I was living in a fairy tale.
original_content: Well, therapy.  And one day I realized I was in love with a man who could never love me back.  I was living in a fairy tale.
element_text: Well, therapy.  And one day I realized I was in love with a man who could never love me back.  I was living in a fairy tale.

element: Action: Will smiles to hear it called that.
original_content: Will smiles to hear it called that.
element_text: Will smiles to hear it called that.

element:
Action: JENNY (CONT'D)
People aren't like they are in stories.  They hurt each other without meaning to.  They are kind and unbelievably cruel at the same moment.  Like me, now.  I'm not sure I should have told you any of this.
element_text:
JENNY (CONT'D)
People aren't like they are in stories.  They hurt each other without meaning to.  They are kind and unbelievably cruel at the same moment.  Like me, now.  I'm not sure I should have told you any of this.

element: Action: Her composure is starting to break.
original_content: Her composure is starting to break.
element_text: Her composure is starting to break.

element: Dialogue: No, I wanted to know.  I'm glad I know.
original_content: No, I wanted to know.  I'm glad I know.
element_text: No, I wanted to know.  I'm glad I know.

element: Action: A long beat, both staring at their iced tea.  Jenny is working herself into more of a state by not talking.
original_content: A long beat, both staring at their iced tea.  Jenny is working herself into more of a state by not talking.
element_text: A long beat, both staring at their iced tea.  Jenny is working herself into more of a state by not talking.

element: Dialogue: I wanted to meet you for the longest time.  I did.
original_content: I wanted to meet you for the longest time.  I did.
element_text: I wanted to meet you for the longest time.  I did.

element: Dialogue: I envied you so much.  The way Eddie would talk about you when you were at Missouri, that award you won.  Congratulations, incidentally.  And when you got the job at the A.P., everything, he was so proud of you.  I mean, that's the thing.  Every moment he loved you.
original_content: I envied you so much.  The way Eddie would talk about you when you were at Missouri, that award you won.  Congratulations, incidentally.  And when you got the job at the A.P., everything, he was so proud of you.  I mean, that's the thing.  Every moment he loved you.
element_text: I envied you so much.  The way Eddie would talk about you when you were at Missouri, that award you won.  Congratulations, incidentally.  And when you got the job at the A.P., everything, he was so proud of you.  I mean, that's the thing.  Every moment he loved you.

element: Action: She's fighting tears, not the first ones she's shed over this.
original_content: She's fighting tears, not the first ones she's shed over this.
element_text: She's fighting tears, not the first ones she's shed over this.

element:
Action: JENNY (CONT'D)
And as brightly as the sun would shine when he was with me, every time he left it disappeared.  I wanted to be as important to him as you were, and I was never going to be.  I was make-believe and his other life, you, were real.
element_text:
JENNY (CONT'D)
And as brightly as the sun would shine when he was with me, every time he left it disappeared.  I wanted to be as important to him as you were, and I was never going to be.  I was make-believe and his other life, you, were real.

element: Action: ANGLE ON Will, sorting through his swirling thoughts.
original_content: ANGLE ON Will, sorting through his swirling thoughts.
element_text: ANGLE ON Will, sorting through his swirling thoughts.

element:
Action: JENNY (CONT'D)
You knew that, didn't you?
element_text:
JENNY (CONT'D)
You knew that, didn't you?

original_content: The hospital is so new, it's not even finished -- thick plastic hangs from exposed framing.  There's no one at the information desk, so Will forges ahead.

original_content: He turns to see his wife at a payphone.  She hangs up.  She was calling him.
element_text: He turns to see his wife at a payphone.  She hangs up.  She was calling him.

element: Dialogue: Your father had a stroke.  He's upstairs with your mom and Dr. Bennett.
original_content: Your father had a stroke.  He's upstairs with your mom and Dr. Bennett.
element_text: Your father had a stroke.  He's upstairs with your mom and Dr. Bennett.

element: Dialogue: Is he going to be okay?
original_content: Is he going to be okay?
element_text: Is he going to be okay?

element: Action: A beat.  How can she answer?
original_content: A beat.  How can she answer?
element_text: A beat.  How can she answer?

element: Action: He half-smiles, realizing the idiocy of his question.  Of course his father's not going to be okay.
original_content: He half-smiles, realizing the idiocy of his question.  Of course his father's not going to be okay.
element_text: He half-smiles, realizing the idiocy of his question.  Of course his father's not going to be okay.

element:
Action: WILL (CONT'D)
What I mean is, will he get back to the way he was when...
element_text:
WILL (CONT'D)
What I mean is, will he get back to the way he was when...

element: Dialogue: No.  He won't.  I'm sorry.
Action: And like that, it's done.  We HOLD ON Will, reeling from the news.
original_content: And like that, it's done.  We HOLD ON Will, reeling from the news.
element_text: And like that, it's done.  We HOLD ON Will, reeling from the news.

element: Action: Edward sleeps peacefully, just an oxygen tube under his nose.  There are no beeping monitors, no blinking lights.  It's mercifully quiet.
original_content: Edward sleeps peacefully, just an oxygen tube under his nose.  There are no beeping monitors, no blinking lights.  It's mercifully quiet.
element_text: Edward sleeps peacefully, just an oxygen tube under his nose.  There are no beeping monitors, no blinking lights.  It's mercifully quiet.

element: Action: Sandra squeezes Will's hand tightly.  She's holding herself together, but it's been a tough day.
original_content: Sandra squeezes Will's hand tightly.  She's holding herself together, but it's been a tough day.
element_text: Sandra squeezes Will's hand tightly.  She's holding herself together, but it's been a tough day.

element: Action: Dr. Bennett has just gone through the details for the third time.
original_content: Dr. Bennett has just gone through the details for the third time.
element_text: Dr. Bennett has just gone through the details for the third time.

element: Dialogue: I don't suppose one of us could stay with him.  In case he...
original_content: I don't suppose one of us could stay with him.  In case he...
element_text: I don't suppose one of us could stay with him.  In case he...

element: Dialogue: In case he wakes up, one of us should be there.
original_content: In case he wakes up, one of us should be there.
element_text: In case he wakes up, one of us should be there.

element: Dialogue: I'll stay.  Why don't you go home with Josephine and I'll stay tonight.
original_content: I'll stay.  Why don't you go home with Josephine and I'll stay tonight.
element_text: I'll stay.  Why don't you go home with Josephine and I'll stay tonight.

element: Dialogue: Mom, do you want some time with Dad?
original_content: Mom, do you want some time with Dad?
element_text: Mom, do you want some time with Dad?

element: Action: A nod, then Will holds the door for Dr. Bennett and Josephine as they leave.  Sandra is alone in the room with her husband.
original_content: A nod, then Will holds the door for Dr. Bennett and Josephine as they leave.  Sandra is alone in the room with her husband.
element_text: A nod, then Will holds the door for Dr. Bennett and Josephine as they leave.  Sandra is alone in the room with her husband.

element: Action: She neatens his hair.  Holds his hand.  As she kisses his fingers, she tweaks her chin with them -- his signature move.
original_content: She neatens his hair.  Holds his hand.  As she kisses his fingers, she tweaks her chin with them -- his signature move.
element_text: She neatens his hair.  Holds his hand.  As she kisses his fingers, she tweaks her chin with them -- his signature move.

element: Action: Sandra waits outside the women's restroom.  Her face is a study in strained composure -- acknowledging the inevitable but refusing to surrender to it.
original_content: Sandra waits outside the women's restroom.  Her face is a study in strained composure -- acknowledging the inevitable but refusing to surrender to it.
element_text: Sandra waits outside the women's restroom.  Her face is a study in strained composure -- acknowledging the inevitable but refusing to surrender to it.

element: Dialogue: I'm sorry.  It seems every hour I have to...
original_content: I'm sorry.  It seems every hour I have to...
element_text: I'm sorry.  It seems every hour I have to...

element: Dialogue: I know.  It was the same when I was carrying Will.  Like clockwork.
original_content: I know.  It was the same when I was carrying Will.  Like clockwork.
element_text: I know.  It was the same when I was carrying Will.  Like clockwork.

element: Action: The two women start to walk, no hurry.
original_content: The two women start to walk, no hurry.
element_text: The two women start to walk, no hurry.

element: Dialogue: Do you like it, being pregnant?
original_content: Do you like it, being pregnant?
element_text: Do you like it, being pregnant?

element: Dialogue: I loved it.  It sounds peculiar, but I loved every minute of it.  I did.  Eddie was travelling a lot, so he was gone, but I felt like I always had a piece of him with me.  A little part of  his soul inside me.  I could feel it.  It was alive and kicking.
original_content: I loved it.  It sounds peculiar, but I loved every minute of it.  I did.  Eddie was travelling a lot, so he was gone, but I felt like I always had a piece of him with me.  A little part of  his soul inside me.  I could feel it.  It was alive and kicking.
element_text: I loved it.  It sounds peculiar, but I loved every minute of it.  I did.  Eddie was travelling a lot, so he was gone, but I felt like I always had a piece of him with me.  A little part of  his soul inside me.  I could feel it.  It was alive and kicking.

element: Action: Sandra has accidentally evoked a storm of emotion.  She struggles to keep it in check.  Almost a whisper...
original_content: Sandra has accidentally evoked a storm of emotion.  She struggles to keep it in check.  Almost a whisper...
element_text: Sandra has accidentally evoked a storm of emotion.  She struggles to keep it in check.  Almost a whisper...

element: Action: With a few breaths, Sandra tries to hold on.  Hold back.
original_content: With a few breaths, Sandra tries to hold on.  Hold back.
element_text: With a few breaths, Sandra tries to hold on.  Hold back.

element: Action: A beat, then Sandra finally melts.  Josephine holds her.  The two women stand together in the hallway, letting the moment be.
original_content: A beat, then Sandra finally melts.  Josephine holds her.  The two women stand together in the hallway, letting the moment be.
element_text: A beat, then Sandra finally melts.  Josephine holds her.  The two women stand together in the hallway, letting the moment be.

original_content: Will sits in a chair beside the bed, working through the crossword puzzle.  A KNOCK as Dr. Bennett enters with his overcoat and bag, ready to leave for the night.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
Glad to see you're not trying to have a heartfelt talk.  It's one of my greatest annoyances, when people talk to those who can't hear them.
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
Glad to see you're not trying to have a heartfelt talk.  It's one of my greatest annoyances, when people talk to those who can't hear them.

element: Dialogue: My father and I have an advantage.  We never talk.
original_content: My father and I have an advantage.  We never talk.
element_text: My father and I have an advantage.  We never talk.

element: Action: Dr. Bennett smiles as he checks Edward's chart.
original_content: Dr. Bennett smiles as he checks Edward's chart.
element_text: Dr. Bennett smiles as he checks Edward's chart.

element:
Action: WILL  (CONT'D)
How long have you known my father?
element_text:
WILL  (CONT'D)
How long have you known my father?

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
Thirty years.  Maybe more.
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
Thirty years.  Maybe more.

element: Dialogue: How would you describe him?

Action: DR. BENNETT
(re: chart)
Five-eleven.  One-eighty.  Regulated hypertension.
(beat)
How would his son describe him?
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
(re: chart)
Five-eleven.  One-eighty.  Regulated hypertension.
(beat)
How would his son describe him?

element: Action: Tables turned, Will searches for an answer.   He doesn't have one.
original_content: Tables turned, Will searches for an answer.   He doesn't have one.
element_text: Tables turned, Will searches for an answer.   He doesn't have one.

element: Action: Dr. Bennett hangs the chart back on the bed.
original_content: Dr. Bennett hangs the chart back on the bed.
element_text: Dr. Bennett hangs the chart back on the bed.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT (CONT'D)
Did your father ever tell you about the day you were born?
element_text:
DR. BENNETT (CONT'D)
Did your father ever tell you about the day you were born?

element: Dialogue: A thousand times.  He caught an uncatchable fish.
original_content: A thousand times.  He caught an uncatchable fish.
element_text: A thousand times.  He caught an uncatchable fish.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
Not that one.  The real story.  Did he ever tell you that?
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
Not that one.  The real story.  Did he ever tell you that?

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT
Your mother came in about three in the afternoon.  Her neighbor drove her, on account of your father was on business in Wichita.  You were born a week early, but there were no complications.  It was a perfect delivery.  Now, your father was sorry to miss it, but it wasn't the custom for the men to be in the room for deliveries then, so I can't see as it would have been much different had he been there.  And that's the real story of how you were born.
element_text:
DR. BENNETT
Your mother came in about three in the afternoon.  Her neighbor drove her, on account of your father was on business in Wichita.  You were born a week early, but there were no complications.  It was a perfect delivery.  Now, your father was sorry to miss it, but it wasn't the custom for the men to be in the room for deliveries then, so I can't see as it would have been much different had he been there.  And that's the real story of how you were born.

element: Action: A long silence, just the sounds of the hospital, doctors being paged.

element:
Action: DR. BENNETT (CONT'D)
Not very exciting, is it?  And I suppose if I had to choose between the true version and an elaborate one involving a fish and a wedding ring, I might choose the fancy version.  But that's just me.

element: Action: THE KEY TO THE CITY.
Action: He smiles, disbelieving.  It's a real thing.
original_content: He smiles, disbelieving.  It's a real thing.

element: Action: Will helps his mother out of a black sedan.  She's well-composed, not nearly the wreck we might have expected.
original_content: Will helps his mother out of a black sedan.  She's well-composed, not nearly the wreck we might have expected.

element: Action: Josephine hugs Dr. Bennett and shakes hands with his WIFE.  The service is crowded, more than 200 people, many more than expected.

element: Action: It's Amos Calloway.  Will doesn't recognize him.

element: Action: The Driver climbs out, a size 15 foot on the gravel.  We TILT UP to see this man is huge.

element: Action: This man is KARL, now 55.  He's not 12 feet tall, but at least six-eight.

element: Action: As the service gets ready to begin, Will guides his mother to a seat near the grave.

element: Action: Sitting beside Will, Josephine spots a stunning ASIAN WOMAN (50) behind them.  A beat later, an identical face with glasses peers out -- the woman's twin sister.
original_content: Sitting beside Will, Josephine spots a stunning ASIAN WOMAN (50) behind them.  A beat later, an identical face with glasses peers out -- the woman's twin sister.

element: Action: Josephine almost GASPS.  She elbows Will, who turns to look.  From this angle, the sisters seem conjoined, but then Jing steps forward.  They're really two separate people.

element: Action: A sea of familiar faces, all of them aged through the years:  BEAMEN, NORTHER WINSLOW, the MAYOR, and ZACKY PRICE.

element: Action: After the service, we see the crowd gathered in small groups.  By the LAUGHTER and hand gestures, we can see they're telling stories.  They're telling Edward's stories.
original_content: After the service, we see the crowd gathered in small groups.  By the LAUGHTER and hand gestures, we can see they're telling stories.  They're telling Edward's stories.

element: Action: We find Will watching them.

Action: WILL (V.O.)
Have you ever heard a joke so many times you've forgotten why it's funny?  But then you hear it again and suddenly it's new.  You remember why you loved it in the first place.
element_text:
WILL (V.O.)
Have you ever heard a joke so many times you've forgotten why it's funny?  But then you hear it again and suddenly it's new.  You remember why you loved it in the first place.

element: Action: We slowly CIRCLE BEHIND a monument, letting it black out the screen.
original_content: We slowly CIRCLE BEHIND a monument, letting it black out the screen.

element: Scene Heading: BLOOM HOUSE BACKYARD - DAY [SUMMER]
Action: Will sits on the porch with Sandra and Josephine, watching his SON play in the pool with two NEIGHBOR KIDS.
original_content: Will sits on the porch with Sandra and Josephine, watching his SON play in the pool with two NEIGHBOR KIDS.
element_text: Will sits on the porch with Sandra and Josephine, watching his SON play in the pool with two NEIGHBOR KIDS.

element: Dialogue: So he said he'd fight the giant who was fifteen feet tall.
original_content: So he said he'd fight the giant who was fifteen feet tall.
element_text: So he said he'd fight the giant who was fifteen feet tall.

element: Dialogue: Dad, that's right, isn't it?
Dialogue: See.  So he was a giant but my grampa was going to fight him because he wasn't afraid of anything because he'd seen how he was going to die in this old lady's glass eye...
original_content: See.  So he was a giant but my grampa was going to fight him because he wasn't afraid of anything because he'd seen how he was going to die in this old lady's glass eye...
element_text: See.  So he was a giant but my grampa was going to fight him because he wasn't afraid of anything because he'd seen how he was going to die in this old lady's glass eye...

element: Action: Will smiles as his son continues the tale, which FADES.  Sandra takes Will's hand in hers, just listening.
original_content: Will smiles as his son continues the tale, which FADES.  Sandra takes Will's hand in hers, just listening.
element_text: Will smiles as his son continues the tale, which FADES.  Sandra takes Will's hand in hers, just listening.

element:
Action: WILL (V.O.)
That was my father's final joke I guess.  A man tells his stories so many times that he becomes the stories.  They live on after him.
element_text:
WILL (V.O.)
That was my father's final joke I guess.  A man tells his stories so many times that he becomes the stories.  They live on after him.

element: Action: A fat and happy catfish swims towards us.
original_content: A fat and happy catfish swims towards us.
element_text: A fat and happy catfish swims towards us.

element:
Action: WILL (V.O.)
And in that way, he becomes immortal.
element_text:
WILL (V.O.)
And in that way, he becomes immortal.
